Yes. And yes.
Quake, surrender now before your people get hurt.
Fat chance, Fury. You betrayed your people and the cause. Today, we're putting you down for good.
DEFEAT <color=#fff568>NICK FURY</color> TO WIN.
Fury's down. I've got the access codes. Let's get out of here!
Captain, the Skull's Nest is just up ahead. Based on the blueprints, we can gain access here.
Good work, Hawkeye. We need to take out any Hydra patrols we encounter to avoid sounding the alarm.
Hydra Operators are part of this patrol. Take them out quickly to avoid the alarm.
They're calling for reinforcements.
1 / 4 stages complete.
If they sound the alarm we're done for.
2 / 4 stages complete.
We can't let them sound the alarm!
3 / 4 stages complete.
We're too late. No way to Red Skull now. The fortress is on lockdown.
Area is secured. Let's keep moving.
Slight change of plans. I'm picking up chatter that Hydra has S.H.I.E.L.D. Resistance fighters up ahead.
If we can free them from their cells and get them into the fight, it'll increase our odds.
Sounds reasonable. We'll provide the cover you need.
We need to free these S.H.I.E.L.D. prisoners.
PROTECT THE <color=#fff568>S.H.I.E.L.D. RESISTANCE PRISONERS</color> AND DEFEAT <color=#fff568>ALL ENEMIES</color> TO WIN.
Our resistance fighters have been taken out. Fall back!
Red Skull's subterreanean bunker is up ahead. Time to end this.
If we defeat Red Skull, you can have the Siege Perilous for your world.
Thank you, Captain. We won't let you down.
You cannot hope to defeat me. Hydra has, and will always, rule this world.
Hail Hydra!!!
DEFEAT <color=#fff568>RED SKULL</color> TO WIN.
With Red Skull gone, Hydra has lost its leader. Now we need to capitalize on the momentum.
We are forever in your debt. When you need us, we'll come to your aid.
Glad to help.
And here is the Siege Perilous.
What do you need this thing for, anyway?
It's a key. A key that opens a magical gate to another dimension, and maybe to victory.
Good luck retaking the world. And keep an eye out for any interdimensional alien invaders.
What was that about?
I've located a dimension with the final artifact we need to open the portal to the Nexus.
You found the Warlock's Eye? We must go there immediately.
And lay waste to any who stand in our way.
Not so fast, Mordo. This dimension is ruled by a benevolent God of Thunder, Thor.
I don't care if it's ruled by the God of Adorable Puppies.
If it stands in the way of our goal, we must eliminate it.
If we treat every obstacle as a threat, we make enemies out of everyone.
We have to be better than that. We will negotiate with this God King Thor.
Perhaps we can even make an ally out of him in our war.
Halt! If you seek an audience with the God King, Thor Odinson, you must prove yourselves worthy.
In combat.
You have shown great spirit. Come! Let us speak...
Good King Thor, we are travelers from another dimension. We need to "borrow" an artifact, the Warlock's Eye, to stop a threat to our dimension.
The Warlock's Eye? I cannot simply "lend" items of power to strangers from another land.
Would it make any difference if I told you that this threat will eventually wipe out your dimension if we do not stop it in ours?
Possibly. You seem noble in your cause and manner. I will grant you your wish, wizard. On one condition...
You must complete the Three Trials of Asgard. If you do, I will grant you the Warlock's Eye.
Trials? Really? Fine. Let's get this over with.
I like your confidence, sorcerer. Let the Trials begin!
First you must best my Captain of the Guard in the Trial of Strength.
Welcome to the Trial of Strength. Get ready to get your butt kicked.
The true test begins in the next chamber. Prepare yourselves.
The final test in the Trial of Strength stands before you.
He is known as the Unbreakable. Nothing will pierce his skin.
Defeat him, and you will move on to the second trial.
Bring it on.
DEFEAT <color=#fff568>LUKE CAGE</color> TO WIN.
Most impressive. Though the next trial will prove more difficult, I am sure of it.
The second trial will put your team's wits and reflexes to the test.
You must defeat my blind Seer: The Daredevil.
This should be fun.
I can sense your fear. But don't worry, this will all be over with soon enough.
We have two more trials to get through.
And then King Thor will give us the Warlock's Eye.
I still think we should just take it from him by force.
That way only makes enemies, not allies. And we need all the allies we can get.
Very well. Bring on the next challenge.
Catch me if you can.
The final test of this trial lies ahead. Good luck. You will need it.
Who do you have in store for us now?
Why none other than my brother, Loki himself!
He is a master of trickery. If you defeat him, you will be worthy of the third trial.
This sort of thing bores me. Let's get it over with, shall we?
DEFEAT <color=#fff568>LOKI</color> TO WIN.
Hah! Seeing Loki be defeated gets me EVERY time. On to the final trial you go.
The third trial begins with a test against the best headhunters from across the entire realm.
Defeat them to proceed.
I suggested a dance-off, but King Thor says this has to be a trial by combat.
Oh well...
In order to be worthy of the final test, you must defeat my champions once again... all at once.
That sounds... challenging.
The test of a true warrior.
Now let's see how you fare against us at full strength.
Well done. Come with me to the next chamber to face the final challenge.
You have proven to be quite impressive, fighting against great champions and numbers.
If you wish me to grant you the Warlock's Eye, you have but one simple task remaining.
You must defeat me.
Just you?
HAH! I like your spirit! Now let's see how you fare against the ruler of this realm.
We must combine our strengths and wits if we have any hope of defeating Thor.
<color=#fff568>THOR THE GOD KING</color> IS A FORCE TO BE RECKONED WITH!
Well done! I am honor-bound to fulfill your request...
...and grant you use of the Warlock's Eye.
But I must ask, what use have you of this powerful artifact?
We need it to enter the Nexus of all Realities to defeat an interdimensional alien invasion from destroying the Multiverse.
When put that way, I probably should have just given it to you in the first place.
Regardless, you have proven worthy allies.
If you need help from the Kingdom of Asgard, we will come to your aid.
Thank you, Thor Odinson. And now we must return to our home and find a way to save it.
Sir, we're getting some strange readings...
This is S.T.R.I.K.E., agent. All we get are strange readings from other dimensions.
Well, that's the thing, sir. Some of these readings are, um, coming from inside the Helicarrier.
MOMENTS LATER...
What. Have you done. To my Helicarrier?!
One word. Cool upgrades!
With Iso-8 and my Large Hadron Kaleidoscope, we can make our forces stronger, smarter, and probably better looking!
S.T.R.I.K.E. Rule One: You want to build a dangerous-looking device?! You ASK.
For permission or forgiveness?
Permission! This thing's giving off all kinds of weird energy. In fact, we're picking up the same energy from the other side of the solar system.
Wait?! Iso-8 energy?!\nWe gotta get it! Quickly! To space!
We tracked the Iso-8 energy signature to this spot where Ultimus kept breaking into our reality.
Probably plenty of Iso-8, and not anyone else in sight! We have it to ourselves!
--kzzzt ELEMENT HARVEST COMMENCING kzzt--
OH, COME ON!
Hmmm... How did Ultron find out about this Iso-8 before I did?
Sure, he's a super-intelligent android who's managed to outthink the Avengers. But he doesn't have Supreme in his name!
If we want this Iso-8 all to ourselves, we're going to have to clear out these drones. Okay, everyone! Time to go to work!
Supreme, report in. This was supposed to be a quick mission. Retrieve some of that material and return.
Ultron's drones are here, gathering up the Iso-8. It's creepy, they're like big silver ants.
Ultron? How did he find out about this?
There is nothing you humans can conceive of that Ultron cannot.
Studying the portals created by Ultimus led me to discover this new element left behind in the fallout.
With my advanced technology, I can harness Iso-8 to do the impossible and improve upon my perfection!
I'm terrified of you, but I've got to be honest - I like your style.
Leave this Iso-8 to me without a fight and your death will be marginally less painful.
Okay, but - and hear me out on this - I want it!
What you view as a victory does not even register as a setback for me, human!
I will seize the Iso-8 using my new technology and wipe you organics from the galaxy.
Yeah, we're the worst. We should probably surrender. Oh, hey, what's that over there?
SURPRISE E.M.P., YOU SILVER JERK!
I YOINKED HIS TECH, LET'S GET OUT OF HERE!
Scientist, what'd you find out there?
Well, while retrieving the Iso-8, I also managed to "invent" this incredible little gadget...
S.T.R.I.K.E.! I have come to retrieve my stolen devices! And to deliver your destruction!
You're bringing a brigade of murderous robots down on us now?
If I had to return every piece of technology I stole, I'd never get any mad science done at all!
Wow, I really thought I outran you! Are you like obsessed with me or something?
My only obsession is with ending organic life-forms who stand in my way!
That's me! I KNEW it!
Phew! That should be the end of Ultron, for now.
Now to go back to my beautiful Large Hadron Kaleidoscope and start cranking out the Iso-8!
Why are we only finding Iso-8 now? Where did it come from?
Psh, YOU'RE only finding it now! I discovered it as soon as Ultimus started turning our dimension into swiss cheese.
Iso-8 is a by-product of rips in the fabric of reality. Ultimus has torn the most holes in our dimension, so we have the most Iso-8.
With my Large Hadron Kaleidoscope - I love saying that - we can harness it! And then A.I.M. will be back on top!
I'm going to get a speedboat!\nNo, a rocket!\nNo, a speedboat with rockets!
Okay. And where exactly are you planning on keeping all of these highly powerful yet unstable crystals?
Way ahead of you, one-eye! I've got a team house hunting as we speak.
And by house hunting I mean, "re-taking our old A.I.M. facilities back by force."
Scientist, this is Graviton. We've arrived at our former A.I.M. lab, but we have bad news.
It appears this lab has an infestation of Ultimus's brainwashed S.H.I.E.L.D. agents.
Well, what are you waiting for? Get rid of 'em!
Graviton! What's your progress? I'm stuffing all this Iso-8 under my mattress up here.
These S.H.I.E.L.D. agents aren't going down easily. They've called in corrupted Avengers as back up.
Wait, was that an explosion? And I'm missing it?!
We'll sooner bring this lab down onto all our heads than let you take it from Ultimus!
If we don't hurry, these S.H.I.E.L.D. agents are going to destroy the facility and crush us all!
DEFEAT THE <color=#fff568>ENEMY OPERATORS</color> TO WIN.
Charges set!
1 / 4 STAGES COMPLETE.
Arming detonators!
2 / 4 STAGES COMPLETE.
Begin the countdown!
3 / 4 STAGES COMPLETE.
We couldn't stop them! This whole place is coming down around us!
We're victorious, but the damage done was too great. We'd risk disaster by storing the Iso-8 here.
Ugh, corrupted S.H.I.E.L.D. agents are SO rude! ...Next time try to get one of their brains for me.
Anyway, I have another location in mind. Pack your antlers, we're going to Canada!
We've arrived outside the warehouse. It's been heavily fortified.
It'll be ideal for storing the Iso-8, but gaining entrance to take it back will prove... challenging.
Did you try knocking?
Oh, I heard you and your team coming from a mile away. Please, try to run! I prefer a moving target.
Like what me and my mercs have done with the place?
Bullseye. An ill-behaved child who throws toys. I've never understood why everyone's so scared of you.
Jeez, Graviton, you're going to hurt my feelings. Tell you what... How about a demonstration?
We've decimated the mercenaries, but...
No! No buts!
…The interior suffered tremendous damage.
Hmmm, and repairs are really going to eat into our profit margins.
Who wants to live in Canada, anyway? Socialized medicine means fewer test subjects for us, and that's no good.
Graviton, you're going on one more trip!
This old A.I.M. stronghold is occupied by a small faction of corrupted Hydra. Should be easy to crush.
We'll send them back to Ultimus in pieces.
Ultimus? Ha! We serve only Hydra!
What?! What gives, we're supposed to be on the same side.
Those of us who joined with S.T.R.I.K.E. were weak!\nHydra cannot be contained!
With the world in chaos and the so-called heroes of Earth preoccupied, now is the time for us to seize power! Hail Hydra!
Ugh, I hate to say it, but... evil game recognize evil game.
You know, we need a new catchphrase! 'Hail Hydra' is so snappy. It could be on t-shirts.
This is off the top of my head, but what about 'Ready... A.I.M... SCIENCE!'?
It lacks a certain... pop.
These Hydra agents are calling in reinforcements from A.I.M. double agents!
Maybe there's a way to take them out without destroying this stronghold in the process.
Oooh! I've got just the thing.
Sending you one of my favorite A.I.M. scientists with a special surprise for these olive drab dorks.
The device she's got will release a patented A.I.M. formula that should take care of our little Hydra problem!
See if you can guess the secret ingredient! Hint: It's poison!
PROTECT YOUR <color=#fff568>OPERATOR</color> TO WIN.
Coalescing gaseous elements...
1 / 4 STAGES COMPLETE.
Loading into the vaporator chamber...
2 / 4 STAGES COMPLETE.
Elements catalyst combining!
3 / 4 STAGES COMPLETE.
Our agent with the toxic gas was taken out! Retreat!
The toxin did its job. The remaining enemies are, let's say, no longer a problem.
Well, sweep 'em aside and put down some shag carpet.
Mama's coming home and bringing her Iso-8 with her!
We've finally loaded all the Iso-8. It'll be safe here until it is ready for the Large Hadron Kaleidoscope.
Perfect! What could possibly go wrong?
Well, look at what we got here! Y'all put together some kind of super-sciencey clubhouse?
We're gonna have to make ourselves at home, maybe relieve you of some of this here Iso-8!
Ah, that. That could go wrong.
How did these slovenly cretins know about Iso-8?
And how'd they know where to find us? This thing has more twists than Reed Richards wringing himself out after a bath.
If y'all are done yappin', I'd like to get to the thievin' and revenge!
Someone else discovered Iso-8 technology?! And then predicted where we'd store ours? It seems impossible!
You're right. Hmm... to figure out where we were keeping Iso-8 and harness its power, you'd have to be a genius.
A beautiful genius, with an army of nerds in cool yellow armor...
WAITAMINUTE! I know who's after us!
It's me!
Press the attack, disciples! We take this island for the Hand and the glory of Ultimus.
Daredevil, you know these spooky sword dorks better than me. At some point they'll get bored and go home, right?
We've been fighting this Hand siege of Hell's Kitchen for days now, so...\nI doubt it.
You know, I love this town but occasionally it's hard to be an optimist in New York.
Well, if we don't get backup soon, it's going to get even harder.
Is now soon enough for you? S.T.R.I.K.E.'s here, Daredevil. Let's finish this.
Nick Fury! We came to conquer Manhattan, but will happily destroy the head of S.T.R.I.K.E. in the process!
Nobu, someone's going to take me down one day. But when it happens, it's not going to be you.
Their ranks are broken. We could have used that backup when this fight started, though...
In case you missed it, Daredevil, this is war. And soldiers hold the line.
What horn-head here is TRYING to say is "thanks." I can't believe you came down here yourself just to help us!
Actually, that's not why I'm here.
Ultimus's portals are damaging our reality immeasurably, and he keeps opening new ones. We're out of time.
I'm ready to rally our forces and take the fight to Ultimus.
But first there's someone in New York whose help I need.
Dr. Richards. Is the device I asked for ready?
Almost. My invention creates an energy field that scrambles Ultimus's path to our reality from other dimensions, but it's temporary.
I worry we're applying a gauze bandage to a wound that needs Unstable Molecule Stitches.
We just need a little time. While your tech keeps Earth safe, we journey to Ultimus's dimension and straight to his home planet -- Hala.
Then we destroy the Conversion Engine and stop Ultimus, along with his entire corrupted army.
Is that surgical enough for you, Dr. Richards?
Wow, what a plan! Ultimus and I will have a good chuckle about it after I bring him your eye-patch as a trophy!
Deadpool? How did you get past my security measures?
A gentleman never asks, and a lady never tells! But let's just say your vents are VERY dusty.
Your S.H.I.E.L.D. agents can finish configuring the portal blocker. I'll take care of these mercenaries.
PROTECT THE OPERATORS TO WIN.
Okay, we've rerouted power from the Atomic Space Displacer! A few more steps to go.
1 / 4 STAGES COMPLETE.
The device is detecting the harmonic resonance of all connecting dimensions! If they disable it now, it'll be disastrous.
2 / 4 STAGES COMPLETE.
I know a deus ex machina when I see one! This is our last chance to stop this thing!
3 / 4 STAGES COMPLETE.
The device's containment protocols are damaged! Everyone evacuate the Baxter Building immediately!
The energy field is ready, but when we activate it, the timer begins. Ultimus's portals will collapse and he'll start repairing them.
It's now or never, Reed. Flipping that switch is the first step to securing Earth, and then the multiverse.
Do it.
Our dimension is safe for the moment. I certainly hope the next step of your plan is ready.
Now that Ultimus can't reinforce his troops here on Earth, we hit them hard. Then we load up and head straight to Hala.
I've been wanting to get face to face with Ultimus again. The Defenders are first in line.
Luke! Fury! My instruments are detecting something... Just before I locked us down, something got through!
Something sure did. And "something" is about to crush you and reopen this dimension for business.
Fury, head to the next part of your plan. This corrupted Carol's not stopping anyone. We got this.
You're the saps Fury tricked into fighting back against Ultimus, huh? A Fury on our world tried that, too.
Let's just say it didn't work out.
Fury, Captain Marvel's down.\nOne fewer threat left on Earth.
I'm forwarding you a set of coordinates. Once we've tied up our loose ends, gather your crew and meet us there.
What kind of loose ends we talking about?
The mystical kind, halfway around the world. America? You're up.
All aboard the Chavez Express, mi gente. We're going for a ride.
Manhattan to Kamar-Taj in seconds flat. Nice work, America. You're on your way to being an Avenger one day, for sure.
Pfft, one day? You'd be lucky to have me any day, Arrow Boy.
Clint, if you're done embarrassing yourself, we need to find Doctor Strange.
I'm already here, Widow. Given the supernatural assault on Kamar-Taj, I've been keeping an eye out for any unannounced visitors.
The assault is why we're here. Fury's called all hands on deck, so let's shut down whoever's giving you trouble and get you to the rendezvous point.
I'm grateful - while I'm the Master of the Mystic Arts, I'm not too proud to accept help. Even from Hawkeye.
Aw, come on! I know I'm half deaf, but I can still read lips. I'm standing right here.
Alright lads, we take this place and the supernatural energies of this Earth are basically ours!
The only thing you and your friends here are taking is a beating. Let's go, chica.
I have led Ultimus's forces to take the Kamar-Taj of countless worlds! Yours will be no different!
Thank you. And you must thank Nick Fury for me as well.
Thank him yourself, Doc. He's waiting for you at these coordinates. We'll reconvene with you there later.
For now we need to get to Muir Island. There's a mutant research facility and some X-Men that could use an assist.
Ready to go, crew?
After you, "Arrow Boy."
OK, Graviton. I got us in. Gather your intel on this world's mutants quickly.
That shouldn't be an issue. I can only imagine the genetic wonders this Muir Island lab contains.
I've never surrendered a tactical position in my life, Graviton. You want this lab, you'll have to take it from the X-Men.
Heh, I doubt your little group can hold off A.I.M. and the Brotherhood all alone.
Oh, they're not alone.
We've breached the perimeter. This fight's half over.
Should we give them one more chance to surrender?
Where's the fun in that?
I tried to tell you, Graviton. I've never given up ground.
I wasn't going to start today.
Happy to help keep your perfect record intact, Cyclops.
Fury's taking the fight to Ultimus, and we need the X-Men.
Finally. Say when and where, bub.
The when is now. As for the where...
Come with me.
The Triskelion, Washington D.C.
S.T.R.I.K.E. agents, we've got precious little time so I'll keep this short.
Our dimension is safe from invasion, but temporarily. We have intel that disabling the Conversion Engine will free Ultimus's army.
And thanks to Phoenix and Ms. Chavez, we have a plan to trap Ultimus for good.
I've prepped a Helicarrier to cross the dimensions between us and Hala. We go there, take out Ultimus, and free the corrupted.
And we end this war. Together.
Exactly right, Captain.
One problem, Fury. Your Helicarrier is never leaving Earth, let alone this dimension!
I'm disappointed, Director. I was able to pinpoint the source of the energy blocking further invasions in no time at all.
And now my family can destroy you and your Helicarrier all at once. As an engineer, I have to say, I find the efficiency very pleasing.
You may get past me, but I can see your plan. You've scrambled the pathway to your dimension, but that also broke the way out.
The jump point to the next reality is outside the solar system, with thousands of Kree warships in your way. You'll be destroyed.
I will say this about our Reed Richards: he never underestimated me.
You think I don't know anyone who can deal with the Kree?
Along with general wanton destruction, it's kind of our thing.
Someone toss this sad pile of rubber in the brig. We're launching this boat.
Wow, outer space! No matter how often I come here, I guess I'm still not used to it.
I'm still not used to seeing hairless apes in red spandex, but you don't hear me yappin' about it.
Rocket, that Kree blockade will tear our Helicarrier apart. I need you to handle it if we're going to reach our jump point.
Got it, blow 'em all up. No problem.
What? We don't have nearly enough firepower to take on that blockade! That's the point!
Star-Lord's right. I'm putting the Helicarrier into stealth mode. Take a team to the lead ship, sabotage the blockade, and we'll slip through.
Got it, infiltration mode. In and out. And if something just HAPPENS to get blown up on the way out... let's just chalk it up to luck.
Good Fury! With the aid of the mighty Mjolnir, we are through the shield and have boarded the command ship!
Blue alert! We have S.T.R.I.K.E. invaders! Fire at will!
Ah, I see Mjolnir's work is not yet done this day! Have at thee!
Okay, that takes care of the guards. Which way to the command center?
Looks like it's through this big sealed door. Oh, dear me, whatever is this thing I've taped to it?
KA-BOOM!!!
Well, so much for the stealth part of this plan. I guess you got to blow something up after all.
Guess I got lucky. Which is to say, I make my own luck. And my own bombs.
Hey, stretch guy! Can you manage to do something with these knobs and buzzers so Fury can get the Helicarrier through?
This Kree technology allows their ships to function as one unit. Disabling it should cause enough confusion to create an exit.
Good Mister Fantastic, I have nothing but faith in you! Besides, who could Ultimus employ to match your titanic intellect?!
Oh, do you Thors not have one of me on your world? Because I am definitely smarter than him.
I do not know what your plans are, but abandon them now and perhaps be spared.
Their plans are simple, brother! They wish to disrupt our ship's communication. But they didn't see this coming...
She's fusing Wakandan tech with the ship! If we don't stop her, I don't know how long it'll take to undo! We'll be out of time!
STOP THE ENEMY OPERATORS AND DEFEAT ALL ENEMIES TO WIN.
Excellent work! Soon the Vibranium pulsing through this ship will make it impossible for them to disable.
1 / 4 STAGES COMPLETE.
They're halfway to creating an all-new kind of technology! I would be impressed if it didn't mean certain doom for us.
2 / 4 STAGES COMPLETE.
Ha, this is child's play!
3 / 4 STAGES COMPLETE.
With enough time I could decode this... but that's time we don't have. We must fall back.
I do not care if you won, I still think I'm smarter than you.
Maybe when your mind is clear. But with your thoughts clouded by Ultimus's will, your genius has sadly been compromised.
There is a clarity of mind that comes with focusing only on saving others - that's why I won.
Ha! Look at all them Kree ships, with their networks all scrambled! They're like farglings with their heads cut off!
Sorry... Farglings?
You've never seen one? Well, when you cut their heads off, they get VERY angry. It's hilarious.
Okay, that's enough weird analogies for one mission. Time to get to the Milano, on to the Helicarrier, and then...
Then... nothing. There is no future for any of you, S.T.R.I.K.E.\nSimply the end.
Prepare to be consumed by flame! Then, through my wrath, reborn as part of pure, cosmic power!
Ooh, the beautiful flaming bird seems extremely upset.
Doesn't take an empath to see that, Mantis! Rocket, you got any more explosives?
To do what with?! She IS an explosive!
I sense it... the Helicarrier. It's preparing to leave. Once I've destroyed you... I shall turn it to ash.
Fury, this corrupted Phoenix is down, but I'm not sure for how long! And those Kree warships are already recalibrating!
We're boarding the Milano and on our way! If you're gonna jump that boat to another dimension, I'd get ready to do it now!
That's our cue. Full speed through the Kree blockade!
Doctor Strange? America? You ready?
My ritual has begun. Ms. Chavez, if you open a portal, we can punch straight through the chain of realities to Hala.
Oh, I'm more than ready for Ultimus to catch these hands.
All crew! Prepare for interdimensional jump to planet Hala!
Ultimus... We're coming for you.
Fury and his loyalists have left for Hala.
The forcefield Richards built has sealed Earth away from the multiverse.
This war has weakened both S.T.R.I.K.E. and their corrupted enemies.
It is time. Doom shall take back the Nexus from those unworthy drones and ensure an invasion of this magnitude never happens again.
Deploy your forces.
Jawohl, Herr Doktor.
We A.I.M. to please.
Get it? AIM? Like, that's our name. We're A.I.M.
The world is in our grasp! Show some decorum!
A lone S.T.R.I.K.E. squad is assaulting a corrupted stronghold in Transia.
We need to be rid of them. Cut their comms and the corrupted will finish them.
Doom has spoken.
We're being attacked from behind!
I didn't escape my home dimension to die here. Hold the line!
Fury left dimensional refugees behind to protect Earth. Fascinating!
Oooh, see if we can take them alive. I love getting new lab rats.
S.T.R.I.K.E.'s force is overextended. The corrupted rally.
Beat them down. Push them back.
Teach them what all must learn: To defy Doom is death.
We will bring them to their Doom!
You test Doom's patience, Supreme.
My apologies, Doctor Doom. I just can't resist testing things.
Doom's forces have weakened both S.T.R.I.K.E. and the corrupted. Ultimus's last force on Earth is the First Legion.
It is time for Doom's agent to reveal himself. Come forward!
I've hidden among these invaders for too long. Now they shall feel the wrath of the Sub-Mariner!
Ronan, our perimeter is breached! Doom's forces are flooding in!
Hold strong! The First Legion will not fall here.
Namor, take a battalion to the left flank. We must defend this location for Ultimus.
I think not, Ronan.
Namor? What are you--
Aaaaaagh!
Namor! You allied yourself with Ultimus, and now you betray him?
Your master's mistake was thinking that Namor serves anyone's interests but his own.
And now you pay the price for his hubris!
It's over, Ronan. Take your Odium and die swiftly.
You... traitor...
You invaders failed to recognize that Earth and its oceans are the dominion of royalty.
Now Doom and I will cleanse this planet of your polluted stench once and for all.
One by one, the dominos fall.
With Fury away on his fool's errand, Doom's victory is assured. We must prevent his return.
We can use the power that resides in K'un-Lun to fortify S.T.R.I.K.E.'s barrier, making it impenetrable to both technology and magic.
The Hand will reclaim K'un-Lun from Ultimus's mystics.
Make it so.
You will never get past us. Ultimus shall prevail!
Pitiful. Submitting to Ultimus has made you weak. This is what true power feels like!
The security here feels pretty low-key. Get it? Loki? I also have an Asgard joke...
Your humor is ill-timed. Be careful not to disappoint Doom, lest you suffer the consequences.
A corrupted Sorcerer Supreme occupies K'un-Lun.
Their magical wards hinder the Hand's efforts.
The Hand are but journeymen. This task requires a master.
Let me show this pretender what mastery of the mystic arts truly means.
Another Mordo, challenging my power again. You never learn.
Your magic paled in comparison to the Strange I know, but it feels good to see that face humbled.
K'un-Lun is ours, though sealing off Earth will require much more power.
Doom knows all. A deep mystical power also lies in the Savage Land.
First Legion scouts claimed it for Ultimus during the beginning of the invasion. Take it from them.
Invaders have breached the Savage Land! First Legion, to arms!
The fools hope to resist. Let's make this quick.
The Savage Land is ours.
Excellent. Now little stands between me and complete control of Nexus Earth.
Our foes have spent their strength. S.T.R.I.K.E.'s Triskelion headquarters is exposed.
Only a skeleton crew remains: supply officers, refugees... riffraff.
Crush their resistance. Capture the Helicarrier.
My forces will overtake them. Hail Hydra!
A.I.M. is at your disposal.
You have the Hand as well.
By tonight, Nexus Earth will belong to Doom.
Hold the line! We cannot fail here!
You fought well. Doom's forces fought better.
Seems to me like Doom hasn't lifted a finger this whole operation...
You doubt Doom's power, Scientist Supreme? Perhaps you'd like a taste of it yourself.
Uh, no, sir, I'm good! Sorry, I thought I was using my inside voice...
Doom thought not.
Hunt down the remaining S.T.R.I.K.E. forces. None shall survive!
No problem! Hey, does anyone hear like... explosions?
That would be me.
So, I get to take out Doctor Doom and the Scientist Supreme.
When Fury told me to stay behind and guard the Triskelion, I didn't think I'd have a shot at you.
The so-called Punisher. You've lost, but Doom is merciful. Bow down before him and be spared.
Buddy, I'd sooner kiss The Thing.
Those who do not serve Doom shall perish. Your choice seals your fate.
This is our final stand! If we fall, nothing will stop Doom from taking Nexus Earth!
I lost one home to Ultimus, I'm not going to lose another to these monsters.
Monster? Hardly.
But if you insist, Doom will be the monster you fear.
S.T.R.I.K.E. is in ruins. Your victory is complete.
Nearly. One task remains: To claim the armies of Ultimus for our own.
Richards believed he sealed this dimension, but the way through is obvious to Doom's superior genius.
Through a combination of magic and technology, a portal has been created to Ultimus's Hala.
Go, seize the Conversion Engine for our cause and see the fall of Fury and Ultimus!
The fate of all the oceans in the multiverse is in my hands.\nI shall not fail.
And, Namor? When we crush Richards and he sees the breadth of his failure, make certain he knows it was Doom who engineered it.
With pleasure.
Namor, that trusting fool. Does he truly believe I will leave him his precious seas?
Once he has seized the Conversion Engine, my magic will strand him across the multiverse.
And then all of Earth will belong to Doom!
THE EDGE OF KREE SPACE\nULTIMUS'S HOME DIMENSION...
Fury, we're through the final dimensional barrier.\nHala, dead ahead.
This is it. Ultimus doesn't know we're coming, but he's too smart to leave the Conversion Engine unguarded. Prepare for resistance.
Like, a bunch of Kree Warships about to intercept our Helicarrier?\nThat kind of resistance?
We're being boarded! Battle stations!
Kree soldiers! Get below decks, find our enemies, and leave no survivors!
These intruders won't live to see Hala.
Fury, Ultimus's attackers are down, but that was just the tip of the spear. There's an armada out there headed for us.
Let them, we're going to plow right through. Colonel Rhodes?
Yes, sir?
Aim this boat at Hala, and don't stop until we hit the surface.
You got it. This isn't going to be smooth, everyone. Brace for impact!
Oof... Status report.
War Machine was able to ram the Helicarrier through the armada, and we crash-landed on Hala's surface.
There's a lot of wounded, but no casualties. And I don't know if this Helicarrier is ever going to fly again.
Whatever the Kree expected us to do, it probably wasn't that.
Hey, any landing you can walk away from, right?
We haven't walked away from it yet. We need to find the Conversion Engine, fast.
Nexus Kree? Time to earn your keep.
We can interface with Ultimus's Kree technology. We will be able to find the Conversion Engine; you just need to keep us safe.
You all heard the blue lady! We watch her back, no matter what!
PROTECT THE KREE OPERATOR TO WIN
We've accessed Ultimus's satellites. Scanning for power surges.
1 / 4 STAGES COMPLETE.
We've narrowed the location down to just a few facilities on Hala.
2 / 4 STAGES COMPLETE.
The corrupted Kree here on Hala are trying to shut us out! I need more time!
3 / 4 STAGES COMPLETE.
We... were too late...
We've located it! We know where the Conversion Engine is.
Finally, something goes right. Lock and load, everyone, we're leaving for those coordinates ASAP.
Hey, Fury? Every sensor in my suit started going off at once which is usually, you know... very bad.
Something's incoming! Everyone, take cover!
S.T.R.I.K.E.! You pushed through my armada, but now you must contend with me!
Congratulations, Nick Fury. I conquered countless Earths, but yours, somehow, continues to be a thorn in my side.
Your people have scraped and fought, only for you to bring them here, to die by my hand.
I wasn't planning on dying today. Anyone else?
I already died once. Didn't much care for it.
Pepper and I have dinner reservations, so dying today... that's not going to work for me.
That settles it, then. S.T.R.I.K.E.? Assemble!
You fools seek the Conversion Engine? Allow me to show you its power firsthand!
FURY! If you think a frontal attack can stop me, you're deluding yourself!
He's not wrong. We're barely holding him off. What's the plan?
Holding him off IS the plan. Star-Lord? Thor? You're up.
We shall not fail.
Yes, we shan't. That's what I was going to say. Before I was so rudely interrupted.
GO!
Okay, team Guardians. We're Fury's space team. That's our thing. So we're the best equipped to find the Conversion Engine.
Yes. And he sent the gorgeous space gods because they are even better than us.
Aye, the green one is correct. So, as leader of Asgard and ranking Avenger, I shall be in charge.
Woah, woah, hold up Hammers & Hobgoblins. Fury put me in charge.
Ha! A delightful jest, Lord of Stars. But the Mighty Thor is definitely in charge.
Boys, boys, boys! I don't know WHAT Nick Fury told you, but... I am DEFINITELY the one in charge!
Mister Sinister? YOU were the spy?
You make it sound so covert and exciting! DO go on...
If Sinister has betrayed Ultimus, then he has chosen death!
So sorry, let's put a pin in this convo for JUST a sec while we crush our foes, hmm?
Tell, Sinister, for what reason shall I believe thee?
Ultimus is letting me have a LOT of fun right now, but the minute he takes out your team, the party's over.
I cleared a path to the Conversion Engine for you, tall, godlike, and golden. So take your hammer and do your thing!
We are left with nary a choice. But hear me: if it's foul betrayal on your mind, I will bring the full force of Asgard down upon thee.
O.M.G., Thor's gonna Thor, I LOVE it. For now, though, I'll leave you boys to it! So long!
Well, I'm sure this is going to go great.
Wouldya look at that! Sinister wasn't kidding, it's right there.
The Conversion Engine. By Odin, the power emanating from it...
I am Groot.
What did he say?
He said it'll blow up REAL good.
This is it! We eliminate these final guards and the Engine can be destroyed!
You'll find that easier said than done! Destroy them!
That's the last one! Can we blow this thing and get offa this flankran planet?!
Aye, angry furred one! Let us "blow this thing" indeed!
Rocket, plant the charges.
Nay. This device is filled with unknown power. Only the might of Mjolnir can be depended on to destroy it.
Look, Quill... I never thought I'd say this, but I think we should let someone other than me blow this thing up.
Foul machine, I strike at thee not just for the forces of S.T.R.I.K.E., but for all beings of free will! Feel the power of the God of Thunder!
Not today, Asgardian.
Holy crap! Ultimus took the full force of Thor's hammer for the machine!
Now... now you have made me quite angry.
The great Nexus rebellion ends here! My empire will be built upon your ashes and my throne from your bones!
I stand here at the source of my power, the Conversion Engine, and that meager attack is all you have to defy me with?
Okay, we hit this guy with everything and now we're out of ammo... Thor? You're in charge. What's the plan?
We do as our allies did, Star-Lord. We fall in glorious battle!
I was really hoping you'd have a better idea than that!
You pitiful things continue to resist, but you cannot stop me! No one in the multiverse can stop me!
Not so fast, Ultimus. We're not out of this fight yet.
You have yet to face me.
Fury?! I left you broken in the ruins of your Helicarrier.
You think I'd use all my tricks right at the start of the fight? I thought you were supposed to be a master tactician.
Send as many mutants as you'd like, Fury. You can't defeat me.
I don't need to defeat you. I just need to imprison you.
America, Phoenix! Open the portal, now!
One-way trip to the M'Kraan Crystal dimension, comin' up.
X-Men! Brotherhood! Drag him through!
ARRRGH!
We're in the M'Kraan dimension... Where is Ultimus?
He's here, I can sense him. We must have been separated when we journeyed through your portal.
You two are the only way anyone's getting in or out of here, so let's get back before WE get separated.
Fellow mystics! S.T.R.I.K.E. has returned after leaving us trapped in this dimension! They cannot be allowed to escape.
We don't have time for this. Take them out!
Ultimus's mystics are down, Fury. They'll be trapped here with their master.
How about we get out of here before we end up stuck with 'em?
Wolverine is right. This dimension is too powerful a prison - America and I can create a way out, but who knows for how long.
Then let's not waste any time. Let's get out of here before Ultimus finds his way back to us.
Too late.
Capturing me in a dimension that's merged with the M'Kraan Crystal is ingenious, Fury. But now you're caught in your own trap!
Have your pawns open a portal back home. Let's finish this battle as warriors rather than as prisoners.
You're fooling yourself, Ultimus. I'd sooner spend 1,000 years trapped in this dimension than release you back into the multiverse.
I have an eternity to break Chavez and Phoenix's wills and get them to release me, Fury.
But I don't need you to be free. This dimension will be your tomb!
I am order incarnate, Fury! The Supreme Intelligence showed me a multiverse infected with free will! Without my control, chaos reigns!
I've heard that pitch before, Ultimus. I'll hear it again. But at least it won't be from you. Cyclops, hit him!
Everyone, back up!
AAAAAARGH! NO!
He's staggered! Phoenix, America, get us out of here!
Portal's open, but it won't last!\nWe need to go now!
Go! Go! Go!
HALA, ULTIMUS'S HOME DIMENSION
They're back! Fury, what happened to Ultimus? Is it over?
Almost... We just need to finally destroy the Conversion Engine.
It will be my pleasure to dismantle this abomination bolt by bolt.
You have to go through me, Magneto.
Namor?! Why would you stop us?
Ultimus is defeated, but another despot will follow. We need the army of corrupted if we hope to stand against them in the future!
For the good of Atlantis, the Sub-Mariner claims the Conversion Engine for Doom.
Namor... You know we can't let you do that.
Namor, Doom is using you. You're trying to protect Atlantis, but you're giving dominion over it to Doom.
The devil I know, Susan. I'm sorry but leave the Conversion Engine in my hands or stand against me and perish.
Namor, you're defeated, but it's not too late to redeem yourself.
The Conversion Engine subverts the free will of anyone under its thrall. It turns them into slaves.
You're not a tyrant. You're a king. I'm asking you to act like one.
Susan... You're right. Even Namor occasionally errs.
Now, stand aside as I do what I should have earlier.
IMPERIOUS REX!
Namor did it! He destroyed the Conversion Engine!
Quick question, though: then why is there still an army of red-eyed meanies outside?
That COULD be my fault? Did I forget to tell you that destroying the engine won't ACTUALLY free the corrupted? My bad!
It's POSSIBLE I told you that so I could rule over some dimensions Ultimus gave me with an army of corrupted?
Don't worry though, I'll stick to my turf, and you guys stick to... Wherever, I guess!\nI don't REALLY care.
Anyway, I'm off to be the king of a bunch of worlds now! Stop by sometime, I just LOVE to entertain!
We never should have trusted Sinister.
We face larger problems than Sinister. While you were away... Doom has taken the Nexus dimension.
Then we'll take it back.
Listen up. Today was a huge victory, but the fight isn't over. Doom, Sinister... They're just the start.
This war has left the multiverse in pieces. And we're the only ones who can pick them up.
S.T.R.I.K.E.? Time to get to work.
The only way those bad guys could have known about the Iso-8 is if I told them! And the only way I'd do that is if I was corrupted!
Ultimus must have his own (less supreme) Scientist Supreme out there working on Iso-8 and putting it in the wrong hands!
So you've been saying for about twenty minutes. But you still haven't said what you want ME to do about it.
Norn Stones! Infinity Stones! If anyone around this flying fortress is going to help me find some special rocks, it's going to be you.
You do have a point. Grant me some of this Iso-8 and I can use my magic to find more in the galaxy.
Perfect! Once we find this other Scientist Supreme and destroy her Large Hadron Kaleidoscope, I'll be the only game in town!
Voila. One interdimensional A.I.M. lab, chock-full of Iso-8.
Intruders! I love intruders! They make incredible lab rats.
GASP! It's you!
You!
Me?
YOU!
How DARE you steal my invention and use it for actual evil!
What would YOU use it for?
Science! Pure and clear and neither good nor evil!
I'm going to give my henchmen extra arms and turn people into M.O.D.O.K.s, and if society wants to judge me, that's their hang-up!
My god... We're so beautiful when we're angry.
Too bad you've got to die anyway!
Aw, come on! Right in the middle of my big speech...
Here's the deal. I can't have you destroying my Large Hadron Kaleidoscope.\nIt took me FOREVER to build.
Well, we can't have you powering up Ultimus's forces with Iso-8.
This is just like in junior high when I had a ponytail, and then the cool girls grew ponytails, and then they said I was copying THEM!
Oh my god, what did you do?!
I turned them into actual ponies.
I have a solution to this impasse. My underlings poison all of you, and then when you're dead, I get to keep my toys!
Wow, now you're trying to ruin POISON for me? I LOVE poison!
My henchmen! I was using those!
You should have sent more than that if you wanted to stop us!
Good note! Open the cages!
I'm sorry. Did she say cages?
Scientist, Loki, other S.T.R.I.K.E. Agents, meet my large adult sons!
RAAAAAARGH!
They'll be covering my escape. Mostly with the sound of your bones breaking! See you at the next Mad Science convention!
Or not! You know, because they killed you!
Well, those extremely disgusting things are defeated. Any sign of your counterpart?
She got away! Damn her ability to exit a room with style!
At least we have her Large Hadron Kaleidoscope! Just look at this baby.
True. Whatever corrupted version of A.I.M. she was running, it'll be a lot harder to make Iso-8 for Ultimus now.
Wait... You're right. She must have been running her own version of A.I.M.! With supplies and profits and everything...
You know what this means, right?
No?
HOSTILE TAKEOVER TIME, BABY!
Okay, if I wanted to take every single asset of an evil A.I.M., where would I start?
Perhaps I might be of some assistance.
Norman Osborn?
As a biologist and a CEO, I'm the only one who understands your goals.
The first rule of business is supply and demand.
So we find their Iso-8 supply... and demand it.
We're under attack! Battle stations, everyone!
Ah, the sound of underlings scrambling.
The source of this other A.I.M.'s Iso-8 is sure to be in their computer banks.
We simply need to protect our S.H.I.E.L.D. Operator while they access the data. And do some damage in the process.
PROTECT YOUR <color=#fff568>OPERATOR</color> TO WIN.
Accessing the corrupted A.I.M.'s files.
1 / 4 STAGES COMPLETE.
They've got a few different bases, narrowing them down...
2 / 4 STAGES COMPLETE.
I've almost got the coordinates! Just a few minutes more.
3 / 4 STAGES COMPLETE.
Our operator has been defeated! We must retreat!
I have the location of their Iso-8 supply! We're good to go!
I gotta hand it to you Normie, your plan is working!
We're not done yet. Now that we know where they're keeping their Iso-8, we need to pay them a little visit...
The intel we pulled indicates your corrupted counterpart is harvesting Iso-8 crystals using a Kree ship orbiting the planet Argor.
We can go clean them out! I'll bring my biggest science bag!
Not only that, dear Scientist. To run the facility, it must be staffed with some of Ultimus's finest corrupted genius-level intellects.
Once we take out their defenses, we offer them a new job - harvesting Iso-8 for us.
Okay, but what if they refuse?
Well... Let's just call them "downsized."
Okay, nerds! Give us your Iso-8 and your undying loyalty to A.I.M.! Or else!
Our Scientist Supreme warned us there might be invaders.
Perhaps we can learn more about them, once we take them apart!
I really thought that recruitment drive would be more fruitful! Instead, they're mostly unconscious.
A shame, we could have used more underlings. Either way, this Iso-8 gathering facility is now ours!
Not yet it's not, ugly.
Killmonger?! What would cause a mercenary like you to throw in with Scientist Supreme?
Iso-8. With it, no one in the multiverse stands a chance against me.
I protect this place, Scientist Supreme powers me up.
I know you're not talking about me, but it's SO confusing when you keep using my name!
This is like the time we hired a second Jeff at our office all over again.
Congratulations! You've done it. Your interdimensional counterpart's assets all belong to A.I.M. now.
And all we had to do to get them was a lot of grievous injury and property damage!
I love free enterprise!
Yes, well, I'm glad you feel that way. Since now, whether you like it or not, A.I.M. can fall under the Oscorp umbrella.
With me, Norman Osborn, in charge!
Really, Norman? You think YOU'RE going to take A.I.M. from MOI?!
Of course. With the world at war and in chaos, now's exactly the time for me to seize as much power as I can.
Think of it less as me taking something from you, and more that your company is free to thrive under my guidance.
Now, if you would, come closer. My junior executives and I are excited to grant you severance!
I can't believe a slobbering, winged, goblin-man would double-cross me like this!
I mean, fool me once...
Osborn has fallen, Scientist. What would you have us do with this wretch?
Wow, GREAT question! I would love to mutate him, but he's already this weird... goblin... thing.
It just feels a little MUCH, you know?
Scientist... You and A.I.M. may have managed to stop me this time. But rest assured, I will unleash my fury upon you...
Ooooh! Great idea, Norman!
We'll turn you in to Fury!
Well, Osborn, we're almost back to S.T.R.I.K.E. HQ! What do you think?
You can either just be indebted to me and A.I.M. for the rest of your scaly life...
Or we tell Fury you tried to betray S.T.R.I.K.E. for personal gain!
Ugh... As loathe as I am to say it, I choose to be in your debt.
I must say, Scientist Supreme, this is far more ruthless than I was expecting.
Shame on you, Osborn. Just because I'm a ton of fun doesn't mean I won't feed you to genetically engineered sharks!
Scientist. We're arriving at the Helicarrier now. But our radar is saying...
It's under siege!
Press the attack, my Brotherhood! If S.T.R.I.K.E. takes our Large Hadron Kaleidoscope, we take theirs!
I thought that other me would have learned her lesson!
Guess we're going to have to send these lackeys back to her, A.I.M. style!
Now, Magneto. Don't you feel silly?
Bah. You foolishly think this victory means your safety. But your Kaleidoscope and stolen Iso-8 will soon be ours.
Okay, well, in the meantime I'll be using it to kick your butts.
So long, mutant jerks! Tell your boss she should accept her losses like a big scientist and stay outta the Nexus!
Why don't you tell her yourself?!
Dang! So, you're just as good at entrances as you are at exits? Respect.
You've stolen my resources, destroyed my hardware, pummelled my staff! I've officially gone from mad scientist to furious scientist!
Oh, get over it! It's nothing you weren't going to do to me!
Sure, but I didn't GET to!
So now we're taking your Large Hadron Kaleidoscope out of this Helicarrier! Or maybe I'll blow it up and kill us all!
You haven't DECIDED yet?
It's whichever comes first!
First I'll crush you under my heel, then I'll retake the Iso-8 you stole from me.
If you think I'm just going to give up that sweet Iso, then you're crazier than I am! And you're me!
No one's making any fancy getaways this time! Sorry!
Ugh... What are you planning to do with me?
Normally I'd LOVE to keep you around for stray experiments. Would REALLY save me the time it'd take to clone myself.
But if you were the only other Scientist Supreme to come up with Iso-8, it must mean you're the second smartest one.
So why don't we keep you around in case you have any other bright ideas! Graviton, take her to the brig!
Now, to start using our Iso-8! I'm sure someone else will patch up all the holes that evil me knocked into the walls.
Scientist! What have you done to my Helicarrier!
Ah, it's good to be back home.
We're through the breach!
By my calculations, Fury, only three more dimensional jumps lay between us and Nexus Earth. We're practically home.
*BOOM*
We're not there yet! What did we just land in the middle of?
We're being fired on by another Kree warship! Sensors detect Inhuman tech, though.
That explains the extra oomph. We're not going to survive long unless we take the ship out. Any volunteers?
Don't sweat it, Fury. The X-Men are on it.
Attention, you have entered the domain of the Kree-Inhuman alliance. Surrender your stolen vessel and face Kree judgment!
The loathsome mutantkind among you will be exterminated, but the rest may yet plead for mercy.
Oh, I'm gonna enjoy whittling down that big stick of yours, bub.
Scott! The Kree console... These readings...
I see them, Storm.
Fury, this is Cyclops! This gunship is down, but three more are coming around. Earth's about to be blockaded!
We're going to have to land this boat while we can. Get your team back here ASAP!
Hey Slim, next time you want to volunteer us for a suicide mission on an alien ship? Let Spider-Man do it.
Corrupted or not, why are those Kree and Inhumans working together to lock down this planet?
We're two dimensions from home, Crystal. The question is, how do we avoid them and get off this Earth?
I can answer both of those questions if you two want to listen.
Wha---? A Negasonic Teenage Warhead? How'd you find us?
You guys landed a giant Kree ship out of nowhere, it wasn't exactly subtle. You're obviously not from around here, and I need help.
With Ultimus gone, those Kree and Inhumans that attacked you are trying to like, take over our Earth or whatever.
Unfortunately, a bunch of corrupted Mutants want to be in charge, too, so they're at war. I just want their war to stop.
Bonus, you help me blow up some of their stuff, it'll help you get past them and get wherever you're going. So, baldy... you in?
Okay, this facility in Greenland is where the corrupted Mutants stage their attacks. The collateral damage is crazy.
It also happens to be near a weak point in the dimensional fabric. We take these guys out, you can get out of here.
Incredible. How did you figure that out?
Um, I'm disaffected. Not stupid. Let's do this.
Mutants and invaders below! Prepare to bow to Inhuman rule!
Never! The Earth belongs to mutantkind, and we'll destroy any that stand in our way!
Looks like the commotion attracted the Inhumans! We're in the middle of this fight all over again.
Ugh. These guys are SO much drama.
Ground team, sitrep! Our ship is en route to the dimensional weak point above your location, but we're taking a lot of fire.
Oh, YOU'RE taking fire?
If this fighting doesn't stop, we're not going to make it out of this dimension! Do what you have to!
Black Bolt and I have reached an agreement. S.T.R.I.K.E.? Negasonic's rebellion? You're both causing too much chaos.
We work together to destroy you for now, and then we settle the war for Earth afterward.
Fury, things are about to get worse down here! I'm not sure how we're going to get out...
Ugh, I've got to do everything myself. Get your friends out of here.
Wait, Negasonic...!
*BOOM!*
My god... She destroyed the entire facility! I don't know if anything could survive that.
She bought us time.\nLet's not waste it.
Did we make it? I can't help but notice that none of us have been forcefully exploded.
We made it. That Negasonic's sacrifice was tragic, but she gave us the chance we needed to reach this dimension.
Okay, but where, exactly, is here?
Intruders! I don't know if Ultimus sent you, but if you want our Earth, you'll have to get past me...\nPresident Stephen Strange!
Oh, brother...
Look, Strange, we're not WITH Ultimus! We're the ones who took him out!
That may be, but I'm responsible for too many lives to take your word for it.
Once you're detained, the Eye of Agamotto will determine the truth.
We don't have time for this...
Hey! Hey! Stop! See, we're the good guys. We could have done so much more damage if we were with Ultimus!
Wait, CAN we do more damage?
No!
Perhaps you're right... We should speak.
I would apologize for striking first, but it's impossible to be too careful.
When Ultimus took this dimension, rich in magic, I battled his forces with everything I had. I thought you heralded his return.
Glad I can give good news for once. You don't need to worry about Ultimus anymore. We imprisoned him. He's done.
Thank the Ancient One, what a relief. And the corrupted? Are they free?
It's complicated. Ultimus isn't around to lead them, but their wills are still broken and some very bad people are taking charge.
Strange! Your time in this office has reached its limits! Surrender the presidency to me and my compatriots at once.
See? He said it was complicated.
Mordo was one of the first that Ultimus corrupted, and with his powers even more of our mystic allies joined the enemy.
It pains me to wield my magic against them, but to protect our world, I won't hesitate.
The Crimson Bands of Cyttorak restrain your pawns, Mordo! They're defeated!
Dare you come forward so we can end this? Or are you too cowardly?
What you call cowardice, I call strategy!
As you weakened yourself on my soldiers, I've tapped into magics you can only imagine!
BEHOLD!
Can anyone tell these guys we were just planning on passing through to get back to the Nexus?
Lock and load, Rocket. We're helping out.
Can your ego allow you to admit that I'm the better sorcerer, Strange? Or must I prove it?
Oh, Mordo. Once we were friends and allies. Look at what Ultimus has made of us.
Let the Mists of Munnopor transport you away until one day, we might be allies again.
I'm glad we could help out, Strange. But S.T.R.I.K.E. and I need to return to the Nexus.
Of course. If Ultimus is truly gone, countless worlds owe you a debt.
Be safe, S.T.R.I.K.E., and know that if Nexus Earth needs help, the Mystic States of this world stands ready to aid you.
Fury, according to every inter-dimensional chart we've assembled over the course of the war... We're finally here.
This dimension is directly adjacent to the Nexus, but due to the methods that Victor used to block us out...
We can't just get back home from anywhere.
If we want to end up on Earth, behind Doom's defenses... We need to land on this Earth and breakthrough.
This is where Ultimus staged his invasion. This Earth isn't going to be friendly, people.
Get ready for a fight!
Super Soldiers! We knew the enemies of Ultimus would return! Fall in and take 'em down!
Pft, like we can't handle a couple of measly Super Soldiers?
Uh, Barton, I think they might ALL be Super Soldiers.
Oh. Well. That's much worse.
Huff... Huff... Okay... About a dozen Captains America down, are we good to go home now?
Sorry, Hawkeye. We've secured our position, but breaking through Doom's defenses isn't a process that can be rushed.
That means it's up to you to buy Reed here all the time he needs.
As long as I get to see the look on Doom's metal mug when we bust back into the Nexus, I can buy as much time as you need.
Namor, do you have the device Doom gave you? The one he claimed would let you return to the Nexus?
I don't know why you demanded I keep this cursed thing. Doom's insulted my honor, I should have cast it into space.
Because, as cunning as Victor is, his ego always gets the better of him.
He couldn't help but embed a sliver of a clue for getting through his defenses, confident I could never understand what he's created.
You're burying the lede here, Reed. Can you get us through?
Give me a lever big enough, Director Fury, and I can move the multiverse.
Boy, Stretcho, I sure hope that's a yes.
Curses! These Super Soldiers are interfering with my ability to decode the device. Can you stop them?
Doctor Richards, I've been in space for too long. Taking out Hydra goons feels just like being home.
DEFEAT THE ENEMY OPERATORS TO WIN.
1 / 4 STAGES COMPLETE.
Their disruptions set my research back! Please, do what you can to stop them!
2 / 4 STAGES COMPLETE.
We're losing data! If this continues, our path home may be lost.
3 / 4 STAGES COMPLETE.
Their scrambling of this device is almost complete!
No, the device Namor gave us, it's useless now. We're trapped...
I've done it! I've managed to descramble the path from this dimension back to Nexus!
What's the next step, Reed?
If we open a portal here on Earth and transport the Kree ship through, we should arrive without Doom ever knowing.
Uh, like that portal, opening there?
S.T.R.I.K.E.! Fury! Richards! You believed you could return to Nexus Earth without Doom knowing?
You forget... Doom knows ALL.
You fools thought Doom would be unprepared? Namor's betrayal was as inevitable as your sad attempts to reclaim what is now mine.
The moment Richards began to descramble the pathways back to Nexus, I was alerted.
You came this far because Doom allowed it.
Crushing you when you thought you were close to victory is all the sweeter.
You haven't beaten us yet, Doom. You talk a big game, but we're taking you down.
Kings don't suffer the indignity of climbing down into the muck to fight with peasants, Fury.\nI have pawns for that.
For Doom!
For Doom!
Your quest ends here, S.T.R.I.K.E.!
Nobu and the Hand were weak. You now face Hydra!
Two of your lieutenants down, Doom. What else you got?
You think those two were the extent of Doom's forces?
I stand at the helm of Earth's armies, and every corrupted agent you freed from Ultimus now serves Doom!
You have a broken Kree ship and a few dozen of Earth's heroes, lost to the winds of the cosmos.
We've got one more thing, Doom.\nWe've got a Helicarrier we rebuilt for this exact moment. You copy, Carol?
Coming in hot, Fury! All aboard, we're ramming this thing through to the Nexus.
You heard the lady, S.T.R.I.K.E.! We're going home.
You view this as a victory, but you're returning to a world where Doom rules! You'll be crushed immediately.
I'll take that challenge. See you on the other side, Doom.
I see we're meeting in another of your "safe houses", eh, Fury?
Each time Doom finds one and drives us back underground, I wonder... how many of these hidden bases do you have?
I have more contingencies than you've got arms, Octavius.
Now, do you have anything constructive to add? Like, maybe, the intel your team was sent to acquire?
Ah, yes. Doom's takeover was met with shockingly little resistance. Few countries turned down his offer of iron-fisted prosperity.
We learned Doom is sending an army to take one particularly pesky rebel nation that's never been conquered...
Wakanda. Director Fury, I cannot stay if my kingdom...
Your Highness. Go. But take backup.
Mercs, fall in line! Doom's forces aren't getting anywhere near Wakandan soil.
Your soldiers are efficient, Killmonger. But do not get comfortable here.
We can settle our history later, cuz. I'm looking forward to it.
These invaders turn back so easily, brother! How did Doctor Doom conquer Earth if his forces can't even finish a fight?
They're falling back, but not retreating. That was only the first wave, Shuri.
Whatever Doom is up to, he has only begun his invasion of Wakanda.
Right you are, Your Highness. I come bearing a message.
Emperor Doom speaks for himself. He sends this telepathic message to your subjects.
Wakandans! Your nation prospered in the old world. Your ingenuity and resourcefulness have not gone unnoticed by Doom.
But the old world is gone. The one Doom has built in its ashes is stronger, safer, and ready for Wakanda to join it.
And if you refuse? I command the army Ultimus once wielded, as well as the forces of every nation on Earth.
Be added to my legion and continue to prosper... or be destroyed by the might of Doom!
Doom claims to be a genius, yet he makes the same threat every conqueror throughout history has made.
Return to your master and tell him that Wakanda will remain free long after he is gone.
Did you think I was a mere messenger, Your Highness? Oh, darling, I'm not just the "join us," I'm also the "or else"!
You may be made of diamond, Ms. Frost... But my kingdom is made of Vibranium.
North perimeter secure. But we got new alarms coming in.
These alarms are guarding the passages we built that lead underground to the Great Mound!
How would Doom know about these, brother? The only ones who knew...
Are you and I. I think I know how Doom discovered them.
Quickly, we need to reach these intruders before it's too late!
As I suspected. Doom has sent corrupted versions of ourselves to take Wakanda.
Wakanda bows to no outsiders. But perhaps the people of Nexus Wakanda will see their way to following us!
Doom will control Wakanda... Once we remove the two of you!
Doom will not stop. Like Ultimus before him, his might is impossible to resist.
Unlike yours, our nation resisted Ultimus, and will continue to stand against Doom. Your will is just too broken to see it.
But you are Wakandan, so we shall keep you in stasis here on Wakandan soil until you can be restored.
How'd the insurrection go, Your Highness?
Wakanda is safe for the moment, Director. But my sister and I must remain here. Doom is not likely to give up.
I understand, but when the resistance needs you...
Of course.
Brother, is that Fury on the line? Excellent!
Upon our return, I checked our comms and someone has been attempting to reach you through us!
A message from someone claiming to have intel... from Madripoor.
THE ISLAND NATION OF MADRIPOOR...
Keep your wits about you. We haven't located our contact yet, and Madripoor is a dangerous place.
A whole island nation of criminals. This place is horrible, dark, and slimy. You'll fit right in, Gobby.
Grr. Fury sent us because my team knows the underworld, insect. I don't know why I must suffer YOUR presence.
Me? I'm here because letting you run around "Crime Island" unsupervised is like letting Galactus loose at a cosmic buffet.
Think of me as a guard, or a chaperone. Whichever annoys you the most.
Goblin! We asked around about our mystery contact who reached out to S.T.R.I.K.E. and...
Well? Spit it out! What did you learn?
They learned that you ain't supposed to go around askin' questions here in Madripoor. Or at least... you're about to.
You fools attracted too much attention!
Said the inconspicuous dinosaur man.
We need to remove these mercenaries before whoever hired them finds out we're sniffing around!
DEFEAT THE <color=#fff568>ENEMY OPERATORS</color> TO WIN.
Calling this S.T.R.I.K.E. sighting in to Doom! The reward's gonna be huge!
1 / 4 STAGES COMPLETE.
Lines of communication are open! Start transmitting their location!
2 / 4 STAGES COMPLETE.
If we don't stop these guys now this mission's going to be over real quick!
3 / 4 STAGES COMPLETE.
Intel relayed to Doom! They're sending an army to stop these guys, we're gonna get paid!
Well, good news, all the new friends you guys made for us are unconscious.
But we're no closer to finding whoever was trying to reach S.T.R.I.K.E.
True. Luckily, with all the commotion you made... I was able to find you.
Mystique? You already work for S.T.R.I.K.E., why the theatrics?
I'm not your Mystique, genius. When S.T.R.I.K.E. rescued people from my dimension, I shape-shifted my way onto a transport.
Once I got here, it was simple enough for me to take over the Madripoor underworld. Until Doom.
Yeah, I imagine metal mouth can't be happy to have a whole island doing dirty deeds dirt cheap on his watch.
Doom's bad for business. So, when I got some interesting information about Latverian energy signatures...
So you called up S.T.R.I.K.E. What have you got for us?
Not here, once we're clear I can... Wait, did you hear that?
*BOOM!*
Breach is clear! We found the targets!
The boss wants Mystique taken alive. The rest... Who cares?
They're down, but not out. Mystique, are you still with us?
Right here.
Never took you for the chivalrous type, Osborn.
Don't be flattered, you have information we need. Now, let's get out of here before this "boss" arrives.
Too late, ugly. And guess what...
There's two of us! Surprise.
So, you two morons have been running Doom's black ops team?
Such nasty names! And after we went to all this trouble of tracking you down to kill you!
We're putting an end to your operation, Mystique. And if we get to crack a few S.T.R.I.K.E. skulls in the process?
Bonus!
They're finally falling back! Mystique, better give us that intel while we have the chance.
Right. An ex-Hydra scientist came to me for protection. He said there are surges of interdimensional energy in Latveria.
I took the data off of him and figured whatever it means... S.T.R.I.K.E. can figure it out.
We'll get this to the big brains back at S.T.R.I.K.E.
Great. We can figure out my fee later.
LATER...
They're gone? Perfect. Did you plant the tracker?
Heh. Right under his big green scales. Osborn's leading us right to Nick Fury, and he has no idea.
From these readings, Doom isn't using the interdimensional energy to open portals.
It's something different. But somehow familiar...
Um, sorry to break up the super genius society meeting, but I think I found a problem.
Parker, if you're not helping decode these readings, you ARE the problem.
My Spider-Sense has been going nuts around Osborn. I assumed it was just his breath, but it got stronger when we got to base.
I think Taskmaster might have planted a tracker on him.
That was hours ago. If Doom has tracked him back to this base, it means they must be...
Tony! Fury! Come in! We've got incoming!
We've broken through the perimeter! For Emperor Doom!
Doom's got a Kree army now?! F.R.I.D.A.Y., look into getting me a Kree army, it seems neat.
First wave of the Kree are down. Radar's picking up more forces coming in quick. A lot more.
Damn! Doom's got us cornered, he's coming in for the kill. We need to fall back.
One problem, Fury - Reed's only halfway through decoding that data.
If we leave now? Whatever Doom's up to stays a mystery.
Then we hold the line. For as long as we can.
Reed, I need that data done, now.
I'm calculating 8,462 variant equations at once, Fury. Even I can only stretch myself so thin.
This base is about to become a crater, Dr. Richards. Go thinner.
Director Fury, we have an incoming transmission.
And I'll bet my good eye I know who it's from.
Nick Fury. Your resistance ends here.
How many of your bases must my corrupted soldiers destroy, Fury?
How many times must your pathetic band scurry away like cockroaches before Doom crushes you under his heel?
You know what? Let's find out. You're the only thing on my schedule, Doom.
Fury, the data's calculated. My god, I know what Victor's up to.
Great! Let's learn about all the, you know, horror at the next rendezvous point, shall we?
You're going nowhere, S.T.R.I.K.E.!
Uh, that doesn't seem like a transmission, Fury.
Your arrogance has forced the hand of Doom! I shall destroy you myself, once and for all!
First you fall, Fury, then S.T.R.I.K.E. ends! With no resistance remaining, Doom takes his rightful place in the center of reality!
And people say I have an ego. See how much worse I could be?
Hey, uh, anyone else reading all the excess energy coming off Doom? Fury... I don't know that we can beat him.
Then we need to hold him off while we get our people to safety. The resistance can't end here.
I'll do what I can to hold him off, but I need serious backup. Like, not the guy made of bees.
I had something in mind.
You ready to hold up your side of our bargain?
Oh, yes. Bring this so-called Doom to me.
Thanos, Doom. Doom, Thanos. You two should get along, you have a LOT in common.
You humans. You let this petty tyrant take over your world?
You speak to someone who once ruled all of reality. Come, and I'll show you the difference between us.
DOCTOR DOOM IS POWERED UP BY INTERDIMENSIONAL ENERGY AND CANNOT BE DEFEATED!
PROTECT YOUR <color=#fff568>OPERATOR</color> IN ORDER TO EVAC THE BASE AND WIN.
Bow before me, Mad Titan. Surrender and perhaps Doom will be merciful. Perhaps.
Um, Doom's shrugging off blasts from Thanos's gauntlet now. I'd be impressed if I wasn't, you know, scared out of my mind.
1 / 4 STAGES COMPLETE.
The drop ship is here, people! Let's clear them a path so we can get out of here!
2 / 4 STAGES COMPLETE.
Most of the team is evaced! Keep buying us time!
3 / 4 STAGES COMPLETE.
This is the end of your rebellion, Fury. But it is just the beginning... for Doom!
You... have not bested me... yet... Doom...
Your perseverance is admirable, but you've lost, Thanos.
Watch, as I crush your precious gems to dust. Then, Doom will do the same to your bones...
Stark, we're clear! Get out of there!
Okay, big purp! Time to go! As much as I hate saving you, we're going to need you.
I will finish this fight, Stark...
Yeah, sure, you're very big and strong. Let's go before Doom catches up.
What's this? Running again?!
Flee, then. This base crumbles and your next will fare no better! There is nowhere on Earth that you can hide!
All... is Doom.
Ant-Man, S.T.R.I.K.E. needs your help.
Wow, me? Seriously? What do you need me to steal?
Nothing. We need a different set of skills this time around.
Deadpool is storming a facility that houses the corrupted Techno Virus. We need you to go in and disable the distribution device.
Have you asked Hope to help on this one? You know, to make sure I don't screw things up this time?
The Wasp is off on a different operation with Black Widow. You're on your own this time.
Alright, Scott... You can DO this...
Okay, listen up. This facility is controlled by a corrupted Vision.
We need you to get in and disable the security grid so we can sneak your support team in.
And Lang, try not to accidentally go Giant-Man on us while in transit.
Last time your enormous butt crushed my favorite laptop.
Yeah, that was an unfortunate mishap. Sorry.
Okay, going tiny to sneak in went smoothly.
This should be a piece of cake as long as I can evade the guards.
Good plan, Scott. Good plan.
USE ANT-MAN'S <color=#fff568>SPECIAL ABILITY</color>\nTO <color=#fff568>ABILITY BLOCK</color> AN ENEMY.
USE HIS <color=#fff568>ULTIMATE ABILITY</color>\nTO <color=#fff568>SLOW</color> ALL OPPONENTS AT ONCE.
I've disabled the security grid. Team is a go to infiltrate the... uh, facility, post haste... now.
Just... Never mind. You get what I'm saying.
The Techno Virus distribution device is just up ahead.
How do you know? Seems kind of weird that an all-powerful A.I. like Vision would just leave that kind of info sitting around.
It took me weeks of analyzing intel, combing through building blueprints, disassembling stolen tech, and interrogating captured Kree.
Well... Okay then. Good on you!
Alright, you guys, I'm just here for the distribution device. I don't want to fight you if I don't have to.
You have to fight us.
It is the will of Ultimus.
Fine. But for the record, I asked.
Deadpool is engaging Vision in the processing center.
PARRY, DODGE, RIPOSTE!
Time to go disable the device. Easy peasy.
Looks like all my favorite heroes are guarding the device up ahead.
And I'm going to have to beat them all up. This sucks.
Ant-Man, we've got an incoming transmission from Wasp.
I'll get it later. We have important work to do.
Alright, team, listen up.
These guys are all my idols, so... I might need some help taking them out. Appreciate the assist.
That fight's gonna be a tough one to erase from my memory...
Lang, the device.
Oh. Right. On it.
Right after I take a peak inside that shiny-looking vault over there... \nCan't pass THAT up...
Huh. It's just an orb chamber. But a REALLY fancy-looking one...
Woah.
Distribution device disabled. You're good to go, Deadpool.
Thanks, Ant-Man! By the way, REALLY digging that suit of yours.
SMOKE BOMB!
Did he just shout "Smoke bomb?"
Lang, I've finished scanning the orb chamber you found inside that vault.
It's unlike anything we've seen before. This chamber is capable of storing incredible amounts of energy inside a single orb.
See, THIS is why I steal stuff. What's the plan?
Similar energy readings were recently found at an abandoned H.A.M.M.E.R. warehouse.
I'm sending a team in. You want in?
In like Flynn.
Who's Flynn?
Never mind.
It's okay to beat up these S.H.I.E.L.D. guys since they're corrupted, right? Still feels wrong...
The energy trail leads inside. Let's move.
Looks like there's a crate of orbs in here that match what we're looking for.
I'm guessing there are a bunch of corrupted jerks guarding it, too? Game time.
These orbs are the property of the one true Vision. Leave now or feel the wrath of Ultimus.
Wait, corrupted Vision escaped?
See, what'd I say? Jerks.
That's the last of them.
Lang, the readings for this orb are off the charts.
We need to bring this orb back to the Helicarrier for further analysis.
Bring a mysterious super-charged orb back onto our flying aircraft carrier. Sounds safe.
Agent Johnson, I just attempted to perform a cursory scan of the orb.
But there's some sort of stasis field blocking my scanners.
Too bad I can't shrink a whole squad into the orb to investigate from the inside.
Actually... that might now be possible.
After pooling our resources together for S.T.R.I.K.E., Hank Pym recently made a breakthrough.
We can now create a force field and safely shrink everything inside.
So let me get this straight.
Hank made some new tech that would greatly enhance our ability to work with Pym Particles, and he didn't tell me about it?
Yep.
That makes sense.
So now, all we have to do is disrupt a small section of the stasis field...
And then, using new experimental Pym tech, shrink us as a team inside the gap.
What could possibly go wrong?
Maybe if I STOPPED talking, bad guys would stop showing up right afterwards.
Surrender now and you will have the honor to join the ranks of the one true Vision's enlightened sect.
Is that an evil cult? That sounds like an evil cult. NO, THANK YOU.
Your window for shrinking inside that orb will be limited. Cover me while I prepare the temporary disruption.
Stasis disrupter powering up...

Kinetic dampers activated. Almost there.
2 / 4 STAGES COMPLETE.
Field disruption point acquired. Preparing for rapid reduction activation...
