So, the X-Men's headquarters is through these woods?
Disguised as a school. Mysterio said that since they're working with S.T.R.I.K.E., they haven't returned yet.
Your X-Men, maybe. This is our base now. And you goons are trespassin'.
You want us to leave, pipsqueak? We'll make our own exit - by puttin' you through a wall!
This is what Fury sends to fight us? A feeble old man, a brute, and thugs?
Quick work for our forces, at least.
Rhino! I can't imagine that's the last of these blasted mutants. Get me into this so-called "Cerebro."
Stand back! AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAH-- *SMASH*
Howzis?
The direct approach? Imprecise, yet... inarguably effective.
A few clipped wires, and... I've got it! Now, let's get out of here with our hides intact.
Next time you send us into a nest of corrupted mutants, Mysterio, a warning would be appreciated.
All of S.T.R.I.K.E.'s intel said the X-Mansion would be empty. If nothing else, you've inadvertantly helped fight off Ultimus.
Why you impertinent, arrogant...
Easy, Toomes. The important thing is you got the piece of Cerebro we need.
Yes! And with your engineering skills, we can adapt it to our purposes. All we need is a little time.
AHEM. "Too bad your time's run out."
Man, I can always count on you dum-dums to give me a perfect entrance line.
Thanks for making such a mess at the X-Mansion. It made it real easy to follow you straight back to your secret headquarters.
Vulture and I have to finish this work. Rhino! Shocker! Fend off these corrupted fiends!
Shocker? Man, the bar for the Sinister Six is a lot lower in this dimension. What's next, you guys are going to let Swarm in?
I don't know what the Shocker is like where you're from, but I promise... I'm meaner.
You know what? You're right, you are meaner... Sorry, did I say meaner? I meant uglier.
Laugh now, bug. But we just crushed you and all your friends.
Heh. Not... all my friends...
Kree? Hydra? Attack!
That loathsome spider brought backup!
If we let Ultimus derail our plans now, we won't get another chance. Are you ready?
All I see is a buncha blue an' green bowling pins waitin' ta be knocked down.
Hell yeah. Let's rumble.
Murdering petty thugs is usually beneath me. But you've made enough trouble for Ultimus to become an exception.
Crushin' those corrupted jerks was actually a pretty good workout.
Don't get used to it. Once this job is over, we're done with S.T.R.I.K.E. Leave Fury to worry about these fools.
I wish I could say I was sorry to hear that, Vulture. But I'll be just as happy to be rid of you.
For now, our gear is ready. Time to put Ultimus's Kingpin back behind bars.
Mysterio, come in. The modified sonic drill worked like a charm. We're in the subterranean level of Kingpin's tower.
Perfect. What do you see there? S.T.R.I.K.E. couldn't get a scan.
An underground submarine base. It must connect to the river, allowing Kingpin to bring resources in and out of the city.
Ingenious, honestly. I'll be stealing this idea in the future.
This must be how Kingpin's amassed his army so quickly without anyone noticing.
Don't look now but seems like a new batch is arrivin' now.
Wow! You all are about the worst looking group of bad guys I've ever seen. And I was raised by Ravagers.
I am Groot.
Pal, you're about to be sawdust.
The area is clear. Ready to head up to the penthouse.
Not quite yet, Vulture. Mysterio? The guards?
One moment...
Wh... what's happenin' to...
Zzzzzzz....
The stolen Cerebro tech allowed me to knock out every guard from your location to the penthouse.
Head to the top. Report back when he's down, and I'll send a S.T.R.I.K.E. team to pick him up.
We're almost at Kingpin. Remember our deal, Osborn.
We clear the way for me to take over, and I'll give you wealth and power you can only dream of, Vulture.
Wealth and power? None of you even understand the meaning of the words.
You've reached me, which is more than most. But this is where things end for you all, I'm afraid.
Once it became clear who was causing me problems, I decided to invite some of your old friends to join us.
Y'all got lucky before. Now it's time for a real beating.
Kingpin's captured. And with a few simple keystrokes, his assets now belong... to me.
Good for you. Now, pay us and we'll be on our way before Fury's flunkies show up.
Ah, Toomes, but you three have yet to live up to your end of the bargain.
Osborn, you double-crossin'...
I said that you needed to clear the way for my ascension. We've knocked out this threat, but Ultimus still stands in the way.
Distasteful as it may seem, you will join with S.T.R.I.K.E. You're going to help bring Ultimus's downfall.
And when this irritating conflict is over, I'll assume power over New York City, and you all will be rewarded handsomely.
Osborn, I didn't think I could hate someone more than the arachnid. But you've reached new heights.
We'll join up with you. And in the end, we'll get what's owed to us. Or you'll feel how sharp the Vulture's claws can be.
Jeez, Torch, what the heck is goin' on here?
No idea! I know we've been gone a while, but I assumed we'd mostly be missing out on hot new TV shows.
TV?! That's all you care about, ya hothead?
I've got to stay in the zeitgeist!
This dimension's Fantastic Four! There's only two of them; this should be all too easy.
Oh yeah? Let's see how easy ya find it when I get my mitts on you!
If we capture these fools, Ultimus will reward us greatly!
Yeah, I wouldn't start planning how you're going to spend that reward quite yet. Flame on!
THE HUMAN TORCH IS A POWERFUL <color=#fff568>BLASTER</color> WHO DEALS MASSIVE AMOUNTS OF DAMAGE AND GRANTS <color=#fff568>OFFENSE UP</color> TO HIS FANTASTIC FOUR ALLIES.
HUMAN TORCH'S <color=#fff568>BASIC ABILITY</color> DEALS DAMAGE AND APPLIES <color=#fff568>BLEED</color> TO HIS FOE. HIS <color=#fff568>ULTIMATE ABILITY</color> DEALS DAMAGE TO THE ENTIRE ENEMY TEAM.
Wow, Torch, you're in town and you don't call?! You know your mother and I worry.
Web-head, what are these Blue Meanies doin' crawling all over the city?
Hoooooo boy, that's a whole thing. Let's take care of these goons and I'll fill you in later.
What in the name of my sweet Aunt Petunia happened here?
Ultimus happened. The whole world's at war. Well, actually, all the worlds.
Ultimus? That Ard-Con dude that Thor fought forever ago?
What? I listen when Reed tells me stuff sometimes.
Yeah, yer fulla multitudes.
That's him, but from another dimension. I'm fighting off his Sinister Six dopplegangers now. Give me a hand and I'll get you up to speed.
I'm back five minutes and you're already begging for my help. What did you do without me?
Huh? Nexus Earth?
Our realities are connected in an intricate string of worlds, one after another. Ultimus's transdimensional devices harness quantum theory to...
Torch? You paying attention?
Hm? Bad guys. Red eyes. Flame on. Got it.
You never studied.
Sorry, some of us were busy getting girls and saving the universe in high school.
He's been gone all this time. I could web him to the bottom of a bridge and no one would know...
You think you're going to ruin my fun, Web-Head?
Me? Never. I just wanted to introduce you to my pal, the Human Torch.
Say, what are you symbiotes vulnerable to again? It's not fire, is it?
Boy, that would be embarrassing.
What a cakewalk! I can't believe those goons were giving you trouble.
Sure, when there's a couple dozen of them. But there are infinite Earths, which means infinite Carnages.
Oh man, and infinite Torches! We better be careful, I don't know if the Nexus can handle that much cool in one place.
Yeah, I'll be sure to alert Doctor Strange. Yeesh.
Okay, Venom! Playtime's over, time to clean up your toys and get ready for your S.T.R.I.K.E. prison cell.
Spider-Man! We have crossed dimensions only to come back to you! To eat... your brains!
Bleck! Brains? Between the goo monsters and goblin thing, your bad guys are all pretty gross, dude.
This from the guy who fights Mole Man.
Well, well. Fury sent the bug and the night light after us, eh? Boys? Let's snuff them both out!
So, there's just an endless supply of our bad guys for Ultimus to pull from?
Every win in the war cuts off some of Ultimus's resources, but yeah, S.T.R.I.K.E.'s dance card is full of these duds.
We've got to stop them! This is cutting into my TV time!
So, what's the deal with this group of Sinister Six? If there's bazillions of them, why send the one and only Human Torch...
(And his faithful sidekick, of course.)
...to deal with these guys specifically?
Ultimus's whole deal is that he takes people like us or ol' drooly Eddie back there and bends them to his will.
S.T.R.I.K.E.'s been getting reports that civilians here are disappearing, and bad guys without glowing red eyes are appearing in their place.
If Ultimus is changing regular people into carbon copies of our worst enemies... we have a whole new problem.
You do have problems, insect. But be reassured - you won't live to worry about them much longer!
Hey, Spidey! I bet I can take out twice as many of these second-rate bad guys as you can.
Wow, you're multiplying by twos now? Reed really stepped up his lesson plan while you were out of town!
Oh, it is ON.
And with the score tied 13 to 13, the fantastic Human Torch sinks a fireball from downtown aaaand...
Wait, Torch!
What's wrong? Can't handle losing at the buzzer?
No, this Vulture! I noticed something...
Wh... Where...
...am I?
Old age makeup! And tech to make it look like this poor guy was the Vulture. It looks like he was being remote-controlled. They all were.
And I think I know the bubble-headed ding-dong behind it. Come on.
Fine, but let the record show that I still won.
Knock knock, fire inspectors!
We got reports of green smoke and maniacal laughter and need to make sure your villainous schemes are up to code.
You! This was my greatest illusion yet, in this dimension or any! I can't believe you figured it out.
Come on, Quentin. We've been fighting for years. You think I don't know how you pull these off?
...Is it magnets? It's magnets, right?
No, man. Come on, it's never magnets.
You always knew how to ruin a trick, Spider-Man. How about this one? Watch as I make you and your friend disappear for good!
Give it up, spooky! Unless you want to leave here with your eyebrows singed off. Assuming you have any under the fishbowl.
How are you going to catch me, Torch, when you don't even know which me is the real one?
I hate it when he does this.
Without this corrupted Mysterio causing confusion, S.T.R.I.K.E. can figure out where the real trouble is.
Thanks for the assist, Hot-Head. I have to admit, this went a lot quicker with you around.
No problem! Always happy to help a fan.
I'm sure things'll be much easier for S.T.R.I.K.E. now that I'm back in town.
Speaking of "Things"...\nI wonder what happened to Ben?
Aw, Yancy St.! Lookit what they done to ya!
I knew the sitcheation had ta be bad if that no-good Yancy St. Gang came askin' for help.
"Dear Crag-Face, while you were out, a bunch of red-eyed jerks took over Yancy Street, and they're even uglier than you!"
"If you can find time in your busy schedule, maybe you can help out the neighborhood where you grew up. - The Yancy Street Gang"
"P.S. Please thank the Invisible Woman for telling you this, since we're pretty sure you can't read!"
The nerve of those goons! Like I ain't done enough for the neighborhood. Me! Idol of millions!
Well, bad news for any of Ultimus's dingbats I find... I got some frustration to work out!
Tear this place apart! Find anything of value, we'll bring it back to Ultimus.
Any locals get in your way, take 'em down.
Howzabout me? Am I local enough for ya?
GULP.
Heh. I love it when they do that.
THE THING IS A BIG BRICK <color=#fff568>BRAWLER</color> WHO SPECIALIZES IN DEALING DAMAGE TO A SINGLE TARGET AND BOOSTING THE <color=#fff568>ARMOR</color> OF HIS FANTASTIC FOUR ALLIES.
THE THING'S ROCKY EXTERIOR DEALS DAMAGE BACK TO ENEMIES WHEN HE'S ATTACKED, MAKING HIM A DEFENSIVE POWERHOUSE AS WELL AS A WRECKING BALL.
Man oh man, if that's the best this Ultimus guy's got, the neighborhood'll be back to normal in no time.
I barely got my knuckles dusty!
Glad to hear it. 'Cause you're not done yet.
Cage! Jones! Good ta see ya! Where'd you come from?
Jess and I heard there's a crew with our faces running around causing trouble.
I know I've been an Avenger and a Defender, but when I was a Hero for Hire, my name was all I had.
Old habits, I guess.
What do you say, big guy? Want to have a good old-fashioned team-up?
Lady, you are speakin' my language! It's Clobberin' Time!
Round up the civilians. We collect enough hostages and S.T.R.I.K.E.'ll be eating out of Ultimus's hand.
There's no way we're letting you take these innocent people.
We've gotta fight off these impostors while S.T.R.I.K.E. evacuates the area!
PROTECT YOUR <color=#fff568>OPERATOR</color> TO WIN.
Securing the perimeter!
1 / 4 STAGES COMPLETE.
We've started extracting people! Just a few more minutes!
2 / 4 STAGES COMPLETE.
The last convoys are loaded, preparing to evac...
3 / 4 STAGES COMPLETE.
Our operator is down. We can't do this without her.
Everyone's to safety.\nNice work, Rocky.
I know things are dire, but I gotta say I missed havin' these dust-ups while we were gallivantin' around the multiverse!
There's plenty more where that came from. What are you doing, anyway? S.T.R.I.K.E. could use you.
Yeah, I'm gonna hook up with Fury after I take care of some business local-like. Someone's causin' trouble on my home turf.
Buncha mercs, looks like. Any idea where they're workin' from?
If it's mercenaries, it's probably Bullseye. You're going to have your big orange hands full.
Need some help?
I thought you'd never ask.
Bullseye's been keeping company with a bunch of Elektras from other dimensions who were still out there killing for cash.
She brings a bunch of Hand assassins with her. It's bad news.
At least with me you know it's nothing personal.
Ah! Dang ninjas!
Did you think you could make this much trouble and we wouldn't come looking for you?
You're a walking pile of bricks, Mr. Grimm. It's hardly subtle.
Yeah, subtlety ain't my forte. Know what is? Knockin' some sense into mooks like you! Now come here a minute...
Finally! Bullseye!
Oh, we're not the big boss. Not yet. But we're more than enough to handle you.
I've haddabout enough of this! Where's that chuckle-head holed up? I'm gonna pay him a visit.
Heh... I wouldn't worry about it... he'll find you...
What the...?! Turned to smoke!
I hate ninjas.
This is where that goon Bullseye's been hidin' out?
He left a trail of chaos leading us right here. It doesn't take my detective skills to figure this out.
Bullseye wants us to find him.
Well, I'd hate ta disappoint.\nHEY POINDEXTER! KNOCK KNOCK!
You found me! It only took you way longer than it should have.
I mean I know you're not the genius member of the group, but yeesh.
Okay, wise guy. I'm servin' you an eviction notice! You're outta Yancy Street, yesterday.
Aw, but I'm just getting settled in. Think of all the fun I can have here!
Soon as I find the cracks in your ugly orange hide, there'll be nothing stopping me! Ah hahahaha!
I don't care what dimension yer in! Ya don't mess with Yancy Street!
Mr. Grimm. Nice work. We can take Bullseye from here.
Hey! Fury! I was gonna look you up when I'm done cleanin' up around here.
People don't look me up. I look them up.
I'll brief you on the Helicarrier.\nOh, and we found this in the wreckage. Had your name on it.
Lemme see that.
"Hey Rock Bottom,\nWe saw what you did for Yancy Street. Turns out you ain't half bad."
"Thanks for doing your part. We'll lay off you for a little bit, at least until this crazy war is over. - The Yancy Street Gang"
"P.S. Don't let it go to your head.\nYour Aunt Petunia still wears combat boots."
Of all the ungrateful... I guess I'll take what I can get.
We've received intel from an anonymous source that Ultimus is planning a surprise attack on our base in Dubai. I need you to guard it.
A whole Kree ambush and you're sending just us? Geez, Fury, I'm either flattered or insulted.
A larger team could tip Ultimus off that we know the attack is coming, and I need to know if I can trust my source.
This source has been right in the past, but be ready for anything.
Please, we're the Fantastic Four. We're ready for EVERYTHING.
Destroy the facility! It should be unguarded.
How's this for guarded?
What?! How did you know we were coming?
Sorry, dude, that's top secret. In fact, it's so secret that we don't even know!
How many of these nerds do we have to fight off? I'm getting bored!
We've got to work on your ability to focus on the task at hand, Johnny.
Hey! Welcome home, Stretch-O! Took yer sweet time, huh?
Hello, Ben. It seems like Earth ended up a bit of a mess in our absence. Let's see if we can help with the cleanup.
MISTER FANTASTIC IS A CONTROLLER WHO USES HIS HYPER-GENIUS TO REMOVE POSITIVE EFFECTS FROM FOES.

MISTER FANTASTIC'S <color=#fff568>BASIC ABILITY</color> ATTACKS A PRIMARY TARGET AND CHAINS TO ADJACENT TARGETS.  HIS <color=#fff568>SPECIAL ABILITY</color> HAS A CHANCE TO APPLY <color=#fff568>STUN</color>.
HIS <color=#fff568>ULTIMATE ABILITY</color> CLEARS <color=#fff568>DEFENSE UP</color> FROM THE TARGET, THEN ATTACKS THAT TARGET.
Director Fury. My family and I are here to help.
Looks like you're down a member. And, disappointingly, the most powerful one.
Susan's on her way. Once we saw the state of the multiverse, we decided to leave the children in a pocket dimension where they'd be safe.
What drew us home were alarms from the Baxter Building - someone's broken in, despite my numerous safeguards.
If they're past your devices, that's cause for concern. I'm sending a team with you.
I hardly think that's necessary...
All due respect, but you haven't fought Ultimus. And anything that gets the Fantastic Four back on the front lines of this war is a priority.
Someone was really able to break into your lab? I mean, sure, I could do it. But I wouldn't.
I didn't, though! Wait, do you think it was evil me? Ant-Man from Another Dimension?
I have microversal traps set to dissuade anyone who might try shrinking themselves in.
But, as I always choose to believe, anything is possible.
Gather what you can! We're not going to get a second chance at this tech.
The Scientist Supreme told us to gather whatever looked like it would deal the most damage.
That'd probably be us then.
Hurry! Get out of here with the goods, we'll hold them off!
Hydra down, but some of the A.I.M. goons got away.
Any one of my inventions could be devastating in the wrong hands. We must find them immediately.
I've already got S.T.R.I.K.E. tracking them. They won't get far.
Geez, Reed, I'm sorry about your lab. They trashed the place.
Honestly, Hawkeye, few things give me as much joy as breaking things down and rebuilding.
If it weren't for the impending danger of one of my creations being used for evil, I'd almost be excited.
Oh, uh... cool, then.
We're certain this is where the A.I.M. scientists that escaped fled to.
We need to identify what was stolen immediately.
You're the infiltration expert, Ms. Romanov. What's the best way in?
Don't feel you need to break in, A.I.M. welcomes you all with open arms.
As new test subjects, of course.
Graviton. I don't know what you're planning to use my technology for, but if you're involved, it's no doubt evil.
Science is neither evil nor good, Richards. It simply is.
My applications, however, are quite evil. Please... observe!
GRAVITON IS A CONTROLLER WHO DEALS EXTRA DAMAGE TO HIS FOES THAT HAVE NEGATIVE EFFECTS ON THEM. HE IS EVEN MORE POTENT WHEN ACCOMPANIED BY A.I.M.
HIS <color=#fff568>BASIC ABILITY</color> GRANTS HIM A BONUS ATTACK FOR EACH NEGATIVE EFFECT ON THE PRIMARY TARGET.

GRAVITON'S <color=#fff568>SPECIAL ABILITY</color> DAMAGES THE PRIMARY TARGET AND ADJACENT ALLIES AND ALSO APPLIES <color=#fff568>SLOW</color>. <color=#fff568>BLEED</color> IS ALSO APPLIED IF SCIENTIST SUPREME IS AN ALLY.
HIS <color=#fff568>ULTIMATE ABILITY</color> DAMAGES AND <color=#fff568>STUNS</color> THE PRIMARY TARGET. THIS ATTACK DOES ADDITIONAL DAMAGE PER NEGATIVE EFFECT ON THE TARGET.
You're beaten, Graviton. Where are my inventions? Until I recover them, we're all in danger.
Ha! You truly do believe that, eh? "Mister Fantastic," forever arrogant.
Quite the opposite, actually. I respect the power of the natural world, even while bending its laws.
With that respect comes a humility that you and A.I.M. have never been able to understand.
Perhaps you'll find that perspective while in a S.T.R.I.K.E. holding cell.
We're in. Nice of Graviton to keep his key card and credentials on him while we kicked his butt.
Uh, Reed? Is that the device they stole? It looks... bigger than I expected.
Hm. This is indeed a problem. It appears they stole my Quantum Mass Enhancer and modified it with some technology that resembles Graviton's.
What is it supposed to do?
I'm not sure what A.I.M. is expecting it to do, but it appears that it will create a black hole large enough to swallow the Earth.
Lucky for us, they've yet to turn it on.
BEGIN THE COUNTDOWN!
Stop! You don't know what you're doing! This could destroy us all!
We cannot trust the enemy! Turn on the device, and welcome in the ascension of A.I.M. and Ultimus!
DEFEAT THE <color=#fff568>ENEMY OPERATORS</COLOR> BEFORE THEY TURN ON THE DEVICE.
Energy has begun to flow to the gravitonium batteries!
1 / 4 STAGES COMPLETE.
Plasma is beginning to flow to the center of the device! Soon A.I.M. will be unstoppable!
2 / 4 STAGES COMPLETE.
These damned fools have almost fully powered the device. This is our last chance to stop them!
3 / 4 STAGES COMPLETE.
We failed. Tell Fury we must begin a planet-wide evacuation immediately.
Scientists down. Phew. I don't know about you guys, but I was not really in the mood to get swallowed by a black hole today.
Actually, that's most of what I was doing in other dimensions. It's fascinating, but it does require the proper gear.
Neat. I have arrows. I don't think that's the kind of gear you meant.
Now all that's left is to disassemble the machine and make sure Ultimus doesn't get his hands on any of the plans for it.
Excuse me, but WHERE is my black hole? I was very clear with my lackeys about wanting a black hole right here.
Wow, Reed Richards! Weird to see you here, this being my secret lab and all. Plus, I heard you were out of town.
I was until someone decided to cowardly steal my inventions.
I mean, if you leave all those cool goodies lying about, it's really your own fault if a mad scientist tries to steal them all for Ultimus.
I've undone your modifications and dismantled my device, so you'll have to make do without.
Ha! I already studied how it works! I can just build another one, dummy. Right after I take care of you and your friends.
I'm impressed you got past Graviton! Truly! But there's a reason he answered to me. Time to see if you can get on my level.
I've prevented countless planetary catastrophes. I don't mean to brag, but I'm not terribly concerned.
Dr. Richards, S.T.R.I.K.E. is saying they detected no transmissions out of the base. Your invention remains in your hands alone.
Outstanding. You have my gratitude. I'll begin rebuilding my lab. We'll need it in the fight against Ultimus.
Unfortunately, we'll have to make do without it. S.T.R.I.K.E. just received a transmission, and it's urgent.
And it's from an old friend of yours.
Surface dwellers! Submit to Ultimus or feel the wrath of Atlantis! So swears Namor, the Sub-Mariner!
Ultimus has corrupted Namor?
That's what's so concerning - he isn't corrupted.
By all appearances, Namor has joined with Ultimus of his own free will and is demanding we surrender to him.
Namor and I have clashed in the past, but I never thought he'd throw in with an interdimensional tyrant. Maybe I can talk some sense into him.
If talking doesn't work, I have some other ideas you can try.
We're here for Namor.
The lord of Atlantis isn't accepting visitors.
I'm disappointed. Tell Namor that hiding behind foot soldiers is beneath him.
We don't plan on relaying the words of a dead man! Kree, strike him down!
Hmm. No sign of Namor, and no path back. Perhaps I can build something to track him.
I don't think that'll be necessary. Some of the corrupted were using mystic powers augmented with powerful Atlantean magic.
Casting a spell to locate that same magic will lead us to more of them...
...and right to Namor. Brilliant.
Here! This is where the magic has led us.
Straight to more of Ultimus's mystic warriors, but no sign of the Sub-Mariner yet. If we have no choice to fight...
Then we fight.
Richards!
Namor, what in the world do you think you're doing?
I'm protecting my people. Ultimus has conquered entire universes. By joining him willfully, Atlantis shall be secured.
And turn a king into a lackey? I've never known you to bow to anyone. Join S.T.R.I.K.E.'s fight against Ultimus.
A king has responsibilities! Atlantis is safe. The surface world can burn, it's of no concern to Namor.
Out of respect for your wife, I'll give you this chance. Return to Nick Fury. Convince him to submit to Ultimus, and be spared.
Do not follow me.
If Namor can't be reasoned with, we have to stop him.
Or at least shut down his invasion. With all the magic powering his army, though, it won't be easy.
This combination of Atlantean magic and corrupted magic energies is no simple spell. It would require an ongoing ritual.
So, if we disrupt it...
Ultimus's forces' mystical advantage will be no more, and we can hold off this attack.
We've found the sorcerers funneling the magic to the rest of Namor's troops!
Wanda, they're... you.
Not the first doppelgangers I've had to face in this war. Perhaps it's unfortunate that it no longer fazes me?
Your resolve is admirable, Ms. Maximoff.
Your powers are impressive, but you don't have the power of the Nexus flowing through you. You never truly stood a chance.
You fools. You were given a chance to survive through the grace of Namor, and you throw it away.
Namor, we've known each other for years. We've stood together against threats of this scale before. Please, don't make me stop you.
You've never faced a threat like Ultimus, Richards. And now his power is combined with the might of Namor! Defend yourself!
IMPERIUS REX!
I'm sorry, but if you won't come to your senses, S.T.R.I.K.E. will have to knock some into you.
NAMOR IS A LETHAL MUTANT BRAWLER WHO CAN PIERCE THE DEFENSES OF SINGLE TARGETS OR OVERWHELM MULTIPLE FOES ON THE BATTLEFIELD WITH THE HELP OF GIGANTO.
Argh!
Have you decided to surrender? It's not too late to help us beat back Ultimus. Think of your people, Namor.
You've won this battle, but I am not finished. You will regret returning to this dimension, Richards. Mark my words.
Damn! Gone again.
Do you think we got through to him?
I've been told I'm one of the smartest people on the planet, but I have never been able to predict the Sub-Mariner.
We can only hope that his conscience returns to him, and he does the right thing.
It's done. Ultimus believes I'm a willing general, all while I manipulated S.T.R.I.K.E. into decimating his mystic forces.
Now Ultimus has one fewer defense for us to assert our control. The plan moves forward unabated.
Excellent. Soon, when it is opportune, I will make my presence known.
Soon, all shall know Doom.
Knock knock, Director Fury! Company's come to call.
HALT! Only authorized personnel allowed past this point!
Ah, love, I'm afraid this is a bit above your pay grade, yeah? How about you shoo and get Mr. Fury.
Put down your weapons and place your hands on your head!
Tell him it's Elsa Bloodstone. Of the Oxford Bloodstones? The famous monster hunters? He'll know who you mean.
S.T.R.I.K.E. dispatch, engaging with the intruder now...
*sigh*\nVery well, then. Let's do it your way.
Are you lads sure you want to do this? Last chance to take leave with your dignity and limbs intact.
All units, fire at will!
Don't say I didn't warn you...
ELSA BLOODSTONE IS A FIERCE SUPERNATURAL BLASTER WHO ALMOST NEVER MISSES HER TARGET.
ELSA'S <color=#fff568>BASIC ABILITY</color> HITS AN ENEMY WITH MULTIPLE ATTACKS, WHILE HER <color=#fff568>SPECIAL ABILITY</color> ATTACKS THE PRIMARY TARGET AND THE MOST INJURED ENEMY.
HER <color=#fff567>ULTIMATE ABILITY</color> IS A DEVASTATING SHOTGUN ATTACK THAT HITS ADJACENT ENEMIES, AND DEALS BONUS DAMAGE FOR EACH <color=#fff567>SUPERNATURAL</color> ALLY.
You feeling good about yourself? Beating up on all these poor rookies?
Ah, excellent, someone with some authority. Tell Nicholas that--
Lady, I'm gonna stop you right there. You drop your weapons and MAYBE you can talk to Fury from the brig.
You know, no one on this Helicarrier has even an ounce of manners.
Okay, I am almost out of ammo and COMPLETELY out of patience.
EXCUSE ME. What in the world do you think you're doing?!
There you are! How DARE you leave me waiting at home for an invite into your little club?!
If you'll ju--
I truly have never been so offended in my life! A SNUB, from Nick Fury! I never!
I'll have you know, I'm already out there, battling Ultimus, doing your job for you! Allow me to share a few exploits...
Hoo boy.
When that tacky, nouveau riche Kingpin took all those civilians hostage, who do you think rescued them?
Bloodstone, if you'll--
That's right! Bloodstone and her team! I was hunting for the undead in New York when I stumbled upon his kidnapping operation...
This corrupted Kingpin was in the middle of ushering these poor souls into some dreadful cargo container when I caught up with him.
Elsa Bloodstone. Finally, a higher class of hero for me to destroy.
You can only crush impoverished lawyers and private investigators for so long without getting bored.
Wilson, I'm sorry to break it to you, but I'm bored with you already. Let's wrap this up quick, shall we?
PROTECT THE <color=#fff568>CIVILIANS</color> AND DEFEAT <color=#fff568>ALL ENEMIES</color> TO WIN.
Wait, no, I definitely saved the civilians... let me start over...
Fisk and his sad group of underlings were hardly a challenge. I even made it home in time for tea.
That's great. Now, if--
And not long after that, I nearly-single-handedly defeated an entire squadron of symbiotes!
Word reached me of rumors from a Congolese village of a great creature that would pull people into the jungle, and they would never return.
Bloodstone, I am TRYING to...
After speaking to the locals, it was clear this was no mystical threat... it was an extraterrestrial one. Symbiotes!
I tracked a corrupted Venom deep into the jungle, where he was infecting anything he could get his tendrils on...
Okay, you atrocious beast, release these people and prepare to be shamed in defeat.
We're not ready to let go of our new friends just yet... maybe you'll join us... become like us...
I'm afraid not. Drool and tendrils are so very last season.
DEFEAT THE <color=#fff568>POWERED-UP VENOM</color> TO WIN.
Poor dear was no match for the might of the Bloodstone, I'm afraid.
Right, about the might of the Bloodstone. I need to--
And it wouldn't be the last time I faced off against an otherworldly threat, either!
Corrupted Asgardians, intruding on my Norwegian holiday! Can you imagine?
The brothers are bad enough, but they'd been joined by their sister who would NOT stop making those hideous undead warriors...
I heard about that. If I could just--
And when I asked her to stop, she got VERY defensive for some reason!
Left unchecked, these Asgardian pests could turn all of Norway into their corrupted playground, and I simply couldn't allow it.
This was supposed to be my time away from the drudgery of destroying the undead, and you've simply ruined it.
Mortal, if you think the magic coming from that dingy gem will be enough to stop me, you've made a deadly mistake.
Dingy? Well, there's no accounting for taste, darling.
After sending them packing back up their rainbow bridge to lick their wounds...
Bloodstone.
...I finally realized that I should be working with you here at S.T.R.I.K.E! And since I've been...
Bloodstone!
...so rudely ignored, I decided to take matters into my own hands, and of course that led me here...
BLOODSTONE!
Yes?
You're right. We need you on the team. And I've been trying to tell you that for FIFTEEN MINUTES.
Temper, temper, Nicholas! No need to shout.
You're a tracker. I need someone tracked. And I need it kept under the radar.
A double agent inside Ultimus's inner circle had been feeding us crucial intel. He's gone dark.
Who is this interdimensional man of mystery?
This is beyond classified information, Bloodstone. You and your team are the only ones who'll know.
Our mole is Mister Sinister.
Assemble a team, find the dimension he's in, and find out why he's suddenly gone quiet.
Sinister was here, in this dimension. I can smell... his evil...
I can hunt anything, but crossing dimensions is a little challenging even for me.
Ghost Rider, darling, I could not do it without you.
More sinners approach! They shall feel my flames!
Yes. Well, grateful as I am, take it down just a bit, would you?
GHOST RIDER IS A MERCILESS BRAWLER WHO EXACTS VENGEANCE ON THE SINFUL.
HIS <color=#fff568>SPECIAL ABILITY</color> ATTACKS THE TARGET AND ADJACENT ENEMIES AND APPLIES <color=#fff568>BLEED</color>.
GHOST RIDER'S <color=#fff568>ULTIMATE ABILITY</color> IS HIS PENANCE STARE, WHICH DEALS MASSIVE <color=#fff568>PIERCING</color> DAMAGE, GRANTS NEGATIVE EFFECTS, AND CAN HEAL GHOST RIDER.
Tell us where Sinister is, Magneto. I've had to look at your garish outfit for too long as it is.
Sinister serves Ultimus, as do we all. He goes where Ultimus wills it.
Well, wherever that is, it's where we're going as well.
Ghost Rider, would you mind taking care of this for me?
With great pleasure...
AHHHHHHHHHH!
Sinister's trail leads deeper into this jungle, but hm...
What troubles you?
Someone's covering up his tracks. Someone quite good, it appears.
I'm glad you appreciate my talents, Ms. Bloodstone.\nBut I'm afraid your journey ends here.
The hunter becoming the hunted, eh? I must say, it's a classic move for a reason.
I have a deep appreciation for tradition. Now, will you surrender, or must I make you?
Sorry, but not giving up is a bit of a tradition of my own.
You've defeated me, but you'll never find your way to Sinister.
Aw, but with you no longer covering his tracks? He's as good as found.
Ta-ta, T'Challa!
Bloodstone, sit rep.
Ah, Fury! After a few delays I've found your man's trail. Straight to this A.I.M. base.
Sinister's expertise is genetics - it's no surprise Ultimus would give him command over his corrupted A.I.M. agents.
Ah, yes! Corrupted A.I.M. agents. That must be who's charging down this hallway towards us. Call you back in a bit, eh?
Ugh, more S.T.R.I.K.E.?! I don't have time for this! I'm already busy enough between taking orders from Sinister and powering up Ravagers with my super-secret new element...
I'm sorry, super-secret what?
WHAT. NOTHING. KILL THEM.
Fury, for someone supposedly on your side, Sinister isn't exactly welcoming us with open arms.
This is exactly why you need to find him. If Sinister is no longer an asset, all the intel he provided is compromised.
Speaking of compromised, our lot needs to reposition. We've made a touch of a mess and I think I hear reinforcements on their way.
Locking and loading. Ta for now!
Ugh, so many resources wasted, all to destroy you. This distraction ends now.
I'd love nothing more, but what are the odds that you'll be dears and defeat yourselves for me?
Very low, I'm afraid.
Then it sounds like a lady's work is never done.
That simply MUST be the last of them.
"Graviton and A.I.M. and Kree, oh my!"
OH, MISTER SINISTER! COME OUT, COME OUT, WHEREVER YOU ARE!
Careful what you wish for, child.
You may not like what you get.
Sinister! Finally! Nick Fury sent me.
He misses your letters, your correspondence full of sweet nothings and Ultimus's secrets.
I assure you - I have no idea what you're talking about.
Ugh, please tell me this isn't some pedestrian double-cross.
I'm not in league with Fury. But I am interested in the effect prolonged exposure to that Bloodstone had on your genetic code.
Time for some hands-on experimentation...
When I demanded inclusion in S.T.R.I.K.E., I expected I'd be hunting down hideous monsters.
Glad to see Fury didn't disappoint.
Heh. Better hope you run out of insults before ammunition, child.
Trust me, love, I've got more than enough of both for you.
MISTER SINISTER IS A MUTANT CONTROLLER AND MASTER OF GENETICS.
HIS <color=#fff568>ULTIMATE ABILITY</color> CREATES A CLONE OF A MEMBER OF THE ENEMY TEAM, AND PUTS THE CLONE UNDER HIS MALICIOUS CONTROL.
You may have won this battle, but Ultimus will reign... you cannot stop him...
YAWN! You know for someone so fabulous, you are absolutely no fun. Say goodbye, beautiful.
Wha--? ARRRGH!
Okay, as loathe as I am to admit it, I'm confused.
Clones, baby!
After my tip let Fury get the jump on those warships near Phobos, Ultimus got suspicious, so I whipped one up to cover my tracks!
And now that you and S.T.R.I.K.E. destroyed my lab? Well, who could suspect little ol' Sinister now?
Right. Well, time to come in from the cold. Father's quite worried.
And end the party so soon?! Not when I've got the juiciest piece of gossip to date.
A little tidbit that will let S.T.R.I.K.E. take out the conversion engine, and end Ultimus... Once and for all.
Fury! I need some damned backup down here, now!
Ultimus air-dropped some lady and her undead army onto Hell's Kitchen! The Defenders held 'em off as long as we could, but we're being overrun!
Hela. She's the Asgardian Goddess of Death. And, yeah, that's as bad as it sounds.
So, when are you sending backup?
Cage, S.T.R.I.K.E. is stretched razor-thin right now. I need you to hold this line.
Fury, you know I never give up, but without backup... Hell's Kitchen is done.
Fear not, Man of Power! Nothing is done for so long as God King Thor draws breath!
I don't know where you came from, pal, but I like your swagger. Let's go.
Hell's Kitchen, eh? What an appropriate setting for my grand arrival in this dimension.
Hela, I am sorry I let Ultimus take you, but your rampage ends here.
Get thine brethren to safety, Luke Cage. Asgard handles its own!
HEIMDALL IS A DEVASTATING <color=#fff568>BRAWLER</color> WHO PROVIDES RESISTANCE TO BLIND TO HIS FELLOW ASGARDIANS AND CAN ENLIST THE AID OF HIS ALLIES DURING BATTLE.
HIS <color=#fff568>SPECIAL ABILITY</color> ATTACKS ALL ENEMIES AND REMOVES <color=#fff568>STEALTH</color> ON EACH ENEMY.
HIS <color=#fff568>ULTIMATE ABILITY</color> WILL ATTACK A PRIMARY TARGET AND THEN ALL ADJACENT TARGETS.
Fury, as promised, we have come to aid you in the battle against Ultimus.
Your Highness, I appreciate the assist, but you mind telling me exactly why one of yours is a problem now?
Aye, our world's Hela has been seized by Ultimus, which did delay our arrival.
Thankfully fate led her to your world. She's escaped, but surely, we can find and stop her with haste!
The hunt for a rogue goddess is the last thing I need right now. Where do we even start looking?
I give unto you Heimdall, my true friend and guardian of the Bifrost. His gift of sight shall locate Hela for your warriors, Fury.
Oh, MY warriors? Where is your royal Asgardian butt going to be?
As king of Asgard, I must protect the nine realms, and Hela has unleashed chaos across all of them!
Stop Hela, good Nicholas! When next we meet, it shall be in the hall of victory!
Thor, your kingly counterpart said Heimdall can find Hela?
That Thor may be pompous, but he is correct. Heimdall, friend, what do your eyes see?
The Bifrost shows me Hela across realities, aboard a Kree warship, drifting through a radiant celestial body.
Kree warships we can handle. Thor, grab anyone who's been to space, find that dimension, and end this.
Calling any Kree within range... our forces are decimated... our crew is doomed...
Do you fear death, little Kree?
Don't worry. Death is the only beginning of your service to Ultimus.
Whatever foul scheme you're enacting, Hela, your folly ends now.
Every Thor I meet...\nAll brawn, no brains.
This isn't the end.\nI'm just getting started.
Hey, spikey goth lady! I'm not sure if you noticed, but we've got you and your buddies surrounded.
Do you, now? Heimdall!\nTo our next destination, please!
Wha--?! Escaped?! Hela has access to the Bifrost!
And what, pray tell, does that mean for those of us who don't speak fantasy novel?
It means, small one, that Hela has corrupted another Heimdall. And with his power, she may go anywhere.
That was a LOT of Kree that Hela just resurrected. And now they could be anywhere.
Wherever Hela goes, she'll raise more fallen warriors for Ultimus's army. Heimdall, do you see them?
Their Heimdall attempts to cloud my vision. He hides their location... but not their trail. We can follow.
That's not a lot of intel. We could be walking into anything.
Then, good captain, we will meet it head on! To battle!
Their trail leads to this snowy kingdom. This place is shrouded in mystery.
And a great deal of supernatural energy. I think I understand why Hela came to this frozen wasteland.
I suggest you develop an appreciation for this place, Loki. It is the last you'll ever see!
DEFEAT <color=#fff568>ALL SUPERNATURAL ENEMIES</color> TO WIN.
Heimdall, I see your mastery of the Bifrost isn't enough to shake these fleas off my back.
Allow me, my lady, to make them regret their persistence.
Hm. I went through all the trouble of bringing those supernatural beings back to life and you defeated them.
How... annoying.
I mean, duh. Didn't Ultimus tell you? Beating bad guys is kind of our whole deal.
Yeah, and when Quill's involved, so's being annoying.
Death is nothing if not persistent. Let's see how you handle something a bit more... challenging.
Heimdall, the others I've risen from death? The corrupted? Bring them to me.
Which of them do you desire, my queen?
Which of them? Oh, my dear... I desire ALL of them.
Lead my forces to victory, Heimdall. I brought you back from death... fail me and to death you'll return.
The corrupted Heimdall has sent Hela away. He plans to fight us on his own...
A mistake at last! If we defeat this Heimdall, Hela's access to the Bifrost will be no more.
Oh, is that all? And if this army defeats us?
Send defeat from your mind, blue robot! For now, we think only of victory!
Heimdall, surrender. You shall be treated with far greater honor by us than your mistress.
I see all, Thor of Nexus. And while I may fall, I see nothing but defeat for those who oppose Ultimus.
Besides, even defeated, I may still serve...
Uh, should this guy be so glow-y and rainbow-y?
These colors are both terrifying and majestic!
With my last breath I use the power of my Bifrost to open pathways for Hela throughout the multiverse!
When you find her, she shall be too powerful for even you to stop!
I am Groot.
I do not know how we'll find them now, good tree.
My sight fails you, my liege. With every dimension now emanating Bifrost energy, there is no trail to follow.
We don't need a trail. She's the Goddess of Death, right?
You've been looking for the light of the Bifrost. Try looking for the darkness of death.
With Gamora's wisdom, I saw this world. Death swirls and bubbles here. We may find Hela yet.
Our new Queen has come and gone already, Asgardian.
If you seek death, though, The Hand is happy to deliver you to it.
I don't get it. Other than because it's freakin' awesome, why would Hela come all the way here for a bunch of undead ninjas?
Hela's power is tied to two things - the realm of death and Asgard itself.
Cut off from her dimension's Asgard, she must be attempting to strengthen her connection to death.
Thor, The Hand mastered death through dark magic...
Aye, magic Hela would put to foul use. Swiftly, Heimdall, we must follow to the next step of her journey!
Space, once more. What dimension has Hela led us to this time?
I know not what lies here, my lord. But I see a shape rising from death, something larger than Hela's powers alone could muster.
Let us push forward and meet this shape head on!
You'll have to push through me first, big guy.
When Ultimus conquered this dimension, I fell in battle. Hela brought me back, on the winning team.
You could join now, or be brought back like me. Doesn't matter to me.
Enough threats! Prepare to die, shirtless one!
These fallen warriors were not the force I saw. They were merely guarding it from us.
Then we push on, to the planet's surface and the true threat!
Even without Heimdall's sight, I can tell... this place is shrouded in death.
If that's Gamora for "I've got the heebie jeebies," then me, too.
I can see a great war that happened here. Mutant felled mutant, leaving only devastation.
I'm sorry, did you say mutants? And something about being brought back from death?
Look upon my power and despair, intruders!
Yeah, this checks out.
Hela! Reveal yourself!
Did you think I was hiding? From your friends? Oh, dear Thor... gods don't hide from insects. They simply ignore them.
Oh yeah? How're you gonna ignore us taking out your freshly minted mutant army?
I didn't come here for an army, creature. I came here for a spark.
Would that be a corrupted piece of the Phoenix Force? Very clever, Hela.
Indeed it is. And now that I have it, you'll see what an army of the dead truly looks like.
Hela's taken the piece of the Phoenix Force. Heimdall, we need you to find her before it's too late.
The Bifrost my doppelganger unleashed blinds me still... I do not know if I can find her.
In all our years, I have never known you to fail me, old friend.
I will open my mind and peer past the light... but it will demand time, and all my concentration.
How much time are you talking about here? Because we've got company, and they don't look like the patient type.
Protect me... I will look as swiftly as I can.
Pal, you got until I run out of ammo. And I never run out of ammo.
PROTECT <color=#fff568>HEIMDALL</color> TO WIN.
Through the rainbow light, I can see a shape... horns and blades...
1 / 4 STAGES COMPLETE.
Death overshadows the Bifrost... I can almost detect Hela's location!
2 / 4 STAGES COMPLETE.
Peering through the endless multiverse, I am upon her... I need moments more!
3 / 4 STAGES COMPLETE.
Heimdall has fallen! Hela has escaped...
I see her! Hela is worlds away, standing in ashes, preparing to raise a world to her cause. We must go, now!
Heimdall, this world is a wasteland. Where are we?
Midgard, my liege. Earth.
In this dimension, the beings of this world destroyed it through depletion of resources and the eventual war that followed.
When Ultimus arrived, he could not conquer the dead.
But by combining my green fires of death with the red-hot Phoenix flames, I can.
This entire world will rise, an army of billions at my command!
Not if our might stops you first! My galactic warriors, to battle!
Hela has already begun raising the dead of this world!
Cool, a couple million of them, like what? Six of us?
I like those odds!
Drax, you never learned math!
I am death, you fools. You attempt to stand against a force of nature!
You strike me down... Ultimus will find another Hela to serve him... to enact this plan... and destroy you all.
Then we shall stand against her as well.
Night night, goth lady.
ARGH!
Taser gun?
Huh, I guess so. I meant to grab my rocket launcher.
Ha ha! Well done, rabbit! Now, a victory is nothing without celebration!
We shall return to the Nexus, enjoy our revels, and bring the full force of Asgard to the fight against Ultimus at last!
*Urgent Woof*
Okay, Lockjaw. I let you teleport me, now what's got you so worked up?
Hey! You! Don't move.
Hydra? Lockjaw, anyone can deal with these goons. Why us?
Radio the Skull, let him know one of the Inhumans got loose.
"Got loose?" Okay, I definitely don't like the sound of that.
Good work, boy.
*Satisfied Woof*
If you have captive Inhumans here, it'd really be in your best interest to set them free and get out of our way, now.
If we did capture those Inhumans, why would I be scared of you?
I don't know. There's always the chance you're the ONE smart Hydra goon.
DEFEAT <color=#fff568>ALL ENEMY OPERATORS</color> TO WIN.
Get the prisoners out of here!
1 / 4 STAGES COMPLETE.
We're halfway through loading them out! Hold her off a little longer.
2 / 4 STAGES COMPLETE.
If they get away with those Inhumans we'll never see them again!
3 / 4 STAGES COMPLETE.
No! They've taken the prisoners!
CRYSTAL IS A POWERFUL <color=#fff568>INHUMAN BLASTER</color> WHO CONTROLS THE ELEMENTS AND DEALS MASSIVE DAMAGE TO HER ENEMIES.
CRYSTAL'S <color=#fff568>PASSIVE ABILITY</color> HEALS INHUMAN ALLIES THE FIRST TIME THEY DROP BELOW 50% HEALTH, CLEARING NEGATIVE STATUS EFFECTS IN THE PROCESS.
CRYSTAL'S <color=#fff568>ULTIMATE ABILITY</color> UNLEASHES A POWERFUL SHARD OF ICE WHICH DEALS ADDITIONAL DAMAGE TO ANY ENEMIES WITH <color=#fff568>SLOW</color>.
The guards are down, but the doors are sealed shut. What do you think, Lockjaw, can you get our friends out?
*Confident Woof*
Ugh... Thanks, buddy.
Yo-Yo? I'm Crystal of the Nexus Dimension. Do you know what happened here?
Red Skull. He took a bunch of us. Started... experimenting.
Red Skull's a tactician and a mastermind, but how did he understand Inhuman physiology enough to do that?
Because he's not working alone. Ultimus has a Karnak.
This is Crystal of the Inhumans calling S.T.R.I.K.E. Do you read me?
Your Highness. What can I do for you?
The Red Skull and Karnak are manipulating Inhumans and mutants on a genetic level. Making them more powerful, but more corruptible.
I was able to rescue a few, but there are more being tortured and corrupted. I can't rescue them alone.
I know we Inhumans stayed out of the fight for too long, but please... something must be done.
Crystal. I launched a team the moment we got your call. Help is on the way.
Crystal! S.T.R.I.K.E.'s here and ready to help.
This is where the other world's Yo-Yo told us the other Inhumans would be taken.
I'm guessing another corrupted Hydra base?
Heh. Good guess.
DEFEAT <color=#fff568>ALL ENEMY OPERATORS</color> TO WIN.
Preparing the hostages for mutation and corruption!
1 / 4 STAGES COMPLETE.
The Inhumans and mutants are restrained and prepped!
2 / 4 STAGES COMPLETE.
Say goodbye to your friends. They're about to belong to Ultimus.
3 / 4 STAGES COMPLETE.
Tell the Red Skull his new army is ready for orders.
Okay, Crossbones. Tell us where Red Skull is hiding, while you still can.
Oh, I'm supposed to be scared of you guys? C'mon...
Us? No.\nHim, though?
*Hungry Woof*
OKAY, OKAY! I'll point you in the right direction, just keep that thing away from me!
Awwww, did you scare the mean evil skeleton man, Lockjaw?
*Proud Woof*
Karnak's a master of hand-to-hand combat, not a science whiz. Why is he so important to Red Skull's plan?
Karnak's power is to find the weakness in anything. Red Skull must have realized that applies to our genetic code as well.
He's finding the weakest link in our Inhuman and mutant DNA and using it to change us into something stronger, but corrupted.
We have to stop them! It's horrible what they're doing!\nNot to mention extremely gross.
That's why we're here, Kamala. Crossbones said this lab is where they're making the formula.
What I don't understand, though, is what evil maniac did the Skull and Karnak get to make their formula?
Oh, I DO love a good entrance line and I'm NOT going to get a better one than that!
Sinister?! But you're supposed to be... Wait. Are you another clone?
As if some clone could be this fabulous! I'm the original article, baby!
Though, I guess a clone would also think that... Ah well, I guess I'll sort it out once you're all dead!
STOP THE <color=#fff568>ENEMY OPERATORS</color> AND DEFEAT <color=#fff568>ALL ENEMIES</color> TO WIN.
Let's see if you're still as much fun once this mutagen is ready and shot right into your DNA!
1 / 4 STAGES COMPLETE.
Such drama! Frankly, I live for it. This serum is halfway ready!
2 / 4 STAGES COMPLETE.
The wait is almost over!
3 / 4 STAGES COMPLETE.
Let's take a peek inside that DNA of yours, see if we can't spruce it up.
Okay, FINE! You beat me, I hope you're all proud of yourselves.
Crystal, we freed the prisoners but one of them is... pretty angry.
Sinister! You dare try and capture The Brotherhood?!
Sinister is just a pawn, Magneto. He'll pay for what he's done, but we need him to tell us where Red Skull is.
Oh, one TEENSY problem? I don't know where he is.
But if you do find him, I might have something that could help...
Talk quick, Sinister. Before I get out of Magneto's way.
Karnak's great at finding others' weaknesses but can't see his own.
Lockjaw can find Inhumans almost anywhere, so we can follow him right to Karnak.
*Proud Woof*
The Brotherhood will join you. My reckoning with the Red Skull is long overdue.
A S.H.I.E.L.D. base? Why would Karnak be here?
Karnak might not be here, but he was. Lockjaw's following a trail - we just have to see where it leads.
That mutt led us right into the middle of this mess!
Hey! Lockjaw's not a mutt! He's purebred Inhuman, aren't you, boy?
Pyro is curt, but he's not wrong.\nWe need to look before we leap.
Fair enough. Okay, boy, where did Karnak... Lockjaw? What are you...?
*About to Teleport Away Woof*
Lockjaw, no! We weren't ready.
What a waste of time! This thing's just chasin' its tail!
S.T.R.I.K.E.! Thank god, Karnak was here, he took out my squad!
*Told-You-So Woof*
Karnak's Inhumans and mutants hit this base like a wrecking ball and then took off!
We're heavily wounded, but the rest of Ultimus's forces are laying siege. If you can hold them off, I can call in an evac pod.
Don't worry. We're here now, and everything's going to be okay.
PROTECT YOUR <color=#fff568>OPERATOR</color> TO WIN.
Sending the call for an evac pod!
1 / 4 STAGES COMPLETE.
Transmission received. Evacuation pod is on its way.
2 / 4 STAGES COMPLETE.
The pod is almost here, just need a little more time...
3 / 4 STAGES COMPLETE.
No! I need more time...
The evac pod is here! You saved my squad, Crystal.
Like I said. Everything's going to be okay.
I guess we didn't need Lockjaw to follow the trail of destruction.
Karnak and those poor mutants are leaving chaos in their wake. Hopefully we're close to finding them.
Or they're close to finding you.\nX-Men? Strike them down.
You dare attempt to trap me a second time, Karnak?!
Your rage is your weakness, Magneto. Let's see what happens when I apply pressure to it.
Karnak, look at what Ultimus and the Red Skull have done to you! To our people!
They will do the same to you! All will be converted to Ultimus's will.
With the serum Red Skull and I designed, you'll face an army of mutants and Inhumans more powerful than you can imagine.
Oh, you mean the serum we have the antidote for?
What!? How?
Courtesy of Mister Sinister. Now roll up your sleeve, Karnak, you're our first patient.
Crystal, mutants, my fellow Inhumans... forgive me.
When Ultimus took my dimension and my will... I was no longer myself.
Bah! I do not forget, Karnak, and I rarely forgive.

DEFEAT THE <color=#fff568>ENEMY OPERATORS</color> TO WIN.

Once connected, we found our final host, and then we spread.

Mayday! Mayday! Agents in trouble. Need emergency evac, ASAP!

In her last report she said Taskmaster didn't recognize her and thought she was a student.
This is all very confusing, sir.
Indeed, it is. Get a team together. You're going back to school.
Welcome, cadets, to Taskmaster's Academy for Espionage and Skullduggery! I'm your instructor, Taskmaster.

TASKMASTER IS A RUTHLESS <color=#fff568>CONTROLLER</color> WHOSE <color=#fff568>BASIC ABILITY</color> DEALS DAMAGE TO HIS TARGET AND STEALS POSITIVE EFFECTS.

You will all make wonderful subjects for the Taskmasters to mimic.
No! This cannot be my end!
So dramatic. Natasha, finish freeing the prisoners.
Coulson? You freed me from that maniac! I gotta give Fury my thanks personally.
You must be our Taskmaster! It's hard to tell with the mask. What happened to you guys?

Turns out it was a trap! That other Taskmaster knocked us out. When I came to, he said my potential was wasted with S.T.R.I.K.E.
He was going to amass his own army of brothers, as it were. We would be the best mercenaries in the omniverse.
An army of thousands of you? No offense but that is terrifying.

A STOLEN KREE WARSHIP, THE EDGE OF MISTER SINISTER'S DIMENSIONAL TERRITORY...
Halt, intruders! You have entered a restricted dimension. Prepare to be annihilated.

I have a bad feeling about this. We should jump to Dimension 13. That's my lucky number.

SWARM USES BUZZED UP <color=#fff568>CHARGES</color> TO ATTACK HIS FOES. ONCE HE RUNS OUT OF <color=#fff568>CHARGES</color> HE STARTS HURTING HIMSELF WITH HIS ATTACKS.
